author: Emeris Pendragon
text:
You are immediately greeted by pleasant staff. We ordered oxtail, jerk chicken, and a whole fish. Every plate was flavorful and absolutely delicious. The vanilla rum cake blew us away! I am not a huge cake and sweets person but I inhaled my slice of cake Lol.
I would definitely recommend this restaurant !

author: Shivi D.
text: Found the macaroni but it's missing the cheese. And flavor. Also it's way over cooked. Very disappointing food but, Stacey, the woman at the window is phenomenal. She always greets you with a smile and is great at her job!

author: Toan
text: Sometimes a change of meal option is needed during a vacation. This comfort food was that option. The oxtail meal was very fulfilling and very good. A great option to pick up and eat at the park or at the benches by the beach, which we did. Easy to order, off a very busy street‚Ä¶ watch out for mopeds and bike rental.

author: Zoe Dunbar
text: I came here just before closing and ordered a medium brown stew chicken and the curry goat. Both were delicious, tasted fresh and well seasoned. Will definitely be going back.

author: Rob Fitzgerald
text: Delicious!! Fresh, home cooking, with just the right amount of Caribbean spices.  We had the escovitch snapper (whole) special with rice and beans and mixed steamed vegetables. Outstanding!

author: Marci Langevin
text: At the Vineyard card the fun is endless. The atmosphere is warm, friendly and welcoming! We carved pumpkins for lighting the way to the corn mazes. What joy! Friday night movies this month! There‚Äôs always something fun for everyone.

author: Andrea Baccarelli
text: The store was okay, but we were disappointed with the payment process. We were asked to approve the total without being told it included a 10% usage tip. It felt misleading.

author: Ronald Balasco
text: Great grocer, thoughtful, wide assortment of products, and pricing that is fair! Excellent choice for healthy groceries at a reasonable price!

author: Mark Alwart
text: what a great find, their gourmet selection it's amazing, lots of gluten free and organic products, better island and off island prices, and lets not forget the friendly knowledgeable staff.

author: Marcella Martins
text: I love this store! since I arrived on the island I was very well received by the team, the service is personalized and I always receive updates on promotions on my cell phone. In addition to shopping for organic products that I love, I am able to make money transfers back to my home country! thank you vg! üíú

author: Angela Sison
text: Best coffee in Vineyard Haven! I go here when I need a little treat. Also, the kafta or chicken shawarma is my go to for a quick lunch! Delicious!

author: Dee Wood
text:
Great place, amazing service! Ordered a latte every day on my vacation! Chocolate cake is AMAZING!!! I was informed by a customer that it is dairy free üò≥ I'm shocked by this because it was so moist. Please ask employee if you have a dairy allergy before ordering.  Ham and cheese croissant equally amazing!

Only criticism I have is there is no wifi ü´§

BYO cup/mug for a $1 off any drink!

author: Todd Rodgers
text: Always excellent - I've enjoyed the lahmajuns, cauliflower wrap, falafel wrap, labneh wrap, pistachio maamoul (if it's called that?), espresso - wonderful! And they seem to always be open. Only drawback is not much seating but there are tables outside and some picnic tables a stone's throw away. Highly recommended!

author: Ariana Thakurdeen
text: Currently on a three month assignment on the Vineyard and this is my go to cafe. Cappuccino is always on point and the food is incredible. Staff is super friendly and if you go enough they remember your order üòÖ

author: Zack Maron
text: Cute cafe!! Food was pretty good, maybe not best ever but it had flavor and was pretty healthy. The coffee is awesome and the vibe is very nice though. Worth a pop in if you are in the area mostly just for a nice drink.

author: Keep Life Simple Allan
text: We stopped by on our walk around Oak Bluffs. We ate outside on the patio.  The fish and chips with Cole slaw and fries were delicious. We.also had some delicious oysters 5 stars.

author: Pete Grahame
text: Here to see family over the holidays. We were steered here by the owner's brother. Who was having a drink with us at the Wharf , Thanks for the amazing hospitality! On our tour around the island.

author: Susan Macbeth
text: Lively atmosphere with attentive staff. The food was fresh and tasty.The pub is great and has wonderful drinks! Pizzas are good and made to order.

author: Jennifer Isaza
text: I got the Portuguese Seafood Stew and was so impressed with the broth flavor and the amount of seafood in it! I normally don‚Äôt love muscles and there was none of the dark gamey flavor I usually dislike. The beer and cocktail selection was pretty good as well and the old copper beer tanks inside gave the place a historic feel. I would not recommend the red ale, it was a bit thematic with the red food coloring but everything else was great üòÇ

author: Andrue Carr
text: My son always chooses off shore ale for his birthday dinner out choice. Portions are excellent, service always supreme. We had 1 issue a few years ago. After mentioning it to our server, the owner promptly appeared,  listened to our concerns.  He went to the kitchen,  returned and completely solved the issue.

author: Ethan Shoe
text: I want to start off by saying I only tried the dips. So, I'm sure their actual food is better than what I got, but this was still my experience. I shared chips and salsa, cheese dip, and guacamole, and the only one that was good was the guac. The cheese dip was okay, but still had a weird taste. The salsa was just bad unfortunately. Service was great at the bar, and the vibe was good otherwise, just get something other than the dips I guess.

author: ana rosso
text:
Okay, this place is never consistent! The only time I liked my food was the first time I ordered it. The second time I ordered a burrito online I got a rice and bean burrito, once I opened I saw it was only rice and beans‚Ä¶. I went back in to complain and the cashier tried to tell me I was wrong until I showed her my online order. I gave them another chance recently and got another rice and bean burrito! The burrito was all rice!!!!! Probably 2 pieces of beans in there. if I wanted just a rice burrito that‚Äôs what I would order but I didn‚Äôt. They just have 0 consistency, they either nail your order or they completely mess it up.

Online ordering should have way more options than it does. Very basic burritos, not much to it, if you order a steak burrito sometimes it comes with enough and other times you get two pieces if that.

author: Ty Orth
text: Food was decent, if not notable. Pleasant area and surroundings for an outdoor restaurant and bar.  Service was average, something along the lines of friendly without smiles. I took one star off for the way their credit card check out process pushes higher tip percentages. I like to tip, and I like to tip well. However, a counter-serve where you stand in line to order and come back to get your own food when it‚Äôs done loses a star for providing a minimum tip percentage option of 18% at checkout.  That should be minimum for a full-service gig.  It leaves a bad taste in my mouth, and I would rather go somewhere that appreciates those kind of tips rather than expects it as their due.  Fair food, fair price for the area, but they lose me on the service front for that.

author: Denise Webster, Realtor
text: My husband and I stopped for a quick bite and the service, especially bar tender, Abso, was incredible attentive, nice and makes great margaritas and fresh lemonade! We had the El Fish and Pollo Asado tacos, WOW they were so yummy and fresh!! Will definitely be back!

author: laurin mitchell
text:
I think people like this place because it‚Äôs mostly all outdoors, including the bar, which gave it a cool atmosphere. The staff was nice but, the food was not so nice.

My boyfriend ordered for us while I was in the restroom (which the toilet seat was barely holding on) and when our food came, I noticed green thick sauce on my taco. The menu said tomatillo sauce, but that didn‚Äôt look like tomatillo. We asked the server if it has avocado in it and he said yes. I‚Äôm unfortunately allergic to avocado and right then told the waiter I was. Since my bf didn‚Äôt tell them of my allergy when ordering (he didn‚Äôt because nothing said guacamole or avocado in the description) I just told the waiter it was fine and gave my bf the tacos. Let me say though, I don‚Äôt understand the deal with putting avocado in everything like, verde or tomatillo salsa?!

Moving on: this is long, bear with me.
1- The corn tortilla wasn‚Äôt homemade, that‚Äôs fine- it‚Äôs an island, but it was chewy from being over greased and heated on the grill.
2-My frozen margarita was more like a sloshy attempt at being frozen.
3-Now, the salsa is where it really counts for me since, I was born and raised in California. It was absolutely not salsa at all. It was essentially red enchilada sauce, red pepper flakes, and cilantro. What‚Äôs a girl gotta do to get some sort of tomato around here? üëÄüëÄ I mean, I still ate some because, everything is expensive on MV and I had to give my taco away. So, skip the salsa, you‚Äôd be better off having their ‚Äúgringo salsa‚Äù or pico de gallo.

author: Debbie J
text: Delicious pizza with vegan cheese always available. Friendly staff; funky, casual vibe. We go back every time we‚Äôre on the Vineyard.

author: niks
text:
I have ordered X large pizza for out, for my friends, the staff was very convient to handle, they give you all needed information and preferences. I realy liked the perfect how it was said time for waiting, 20 minutes usually  for pizza. I didnt eat, but friends were delighted.
They have pizzas, sandwiches for breakfast, teriyaki, chicken fingers, mozzarela sticks, and bunch of different food. It isnt very healthy meals option restaurant but it is very good pizzeria and fast, quick, big portions food.

author: Olivia Braaten
text:
I walked out pretty upset, actually (but...stay tuned). We ordered for a pre-sunset pick-up on our way to South Beach. We received notification that it was ready at 5:28 -- perfect! Walked in. Actually not ready. Due to an unexplained "mistake" in the kitchen, we had to wait 30 minutes, and with six little children sitting in the car, and sunset at 6:10, this wasn't ideal. It would have been a nice touch to offer something to make up for it, but other than "it'll be a few more minutes," nobody said anything. Sitting in an empty restaurant watching the clock is no fun.

So did I expect to be posting a 1-star review? Yeah. But I'm not, because, honestly, the pizza is ridiculously good. So good, that frankly, it's worth the wait. We got a GF pepperoni (heads up, that comes in small -- the Instacart menu didn't indicate, so we thought it was going to be bigger) and Talia's Choice (artichoke, garlic, mushroom, pesto). Quite possibly the best pizza I've ever had, and I would try it again.

author: Emma Martinez
text:
We ordered the XL Brazilian Pizza and it was amazing. Really delicious. Crispy on the edges and soft delicious middle!
Excellent customer service.
Great price!
Will definitely come again!

author: M&V S
text: Giving 3 stars because the woman on the phone was very nice. However I must warn other vegans, their pizza dough is NOT vegan. They have vegan cheese but the dough has eggs in it so, sadly, they DO NOT have vegan pizza. Which is super weird and unnecessary, pizza dough does not typically have eggs. Just because a restaurant offers a vegan item does not mean the item is actually vegan. As someone with allergy to eggs I find this misinformation very dangerous.

author: Ron Rogers
text: Dark old school pub atmosphere. The service is spotty. We were charged for something we did order. The food is pretty good. We ordered chicken pot pie 5/5 and bangers and mash 3.5/5.

author: Chris Smith
text: Nice pub for having a pint. You even get a wooden nickel for each one you drink. Had the shrimp Po boy and it was very flavorful. The French fries were also good. Really nice atmosphere and friendly staff. I noticed on the bottom of the menu that there is a 3% surcharge on the bill to help top up wages for the staff. You could opt out of this if you wanted. This is so great and I am totally for it. ALL staff should get a living wage so that you don't have to rely on tips.

author: Erin Ranegan
text: We got the lobster roll and shepherds pie it was the best lobster roll on the island by far. The ambiance reminds me of Ireland and the shepherds pie was so delicious and ginormous portion. Our waitress was amazing love her I wish I remembered her name :( (this place made me disappointed by the famous rockfish)

author: Maggie J
text: Came on a Friday night around 8 pm with a large group and sat inside. Service through the evening was fine but not great. We ordered a round of espresso martinis to start and I would really not recommend them. For dinner I ordered the cauliflower curry but the waiter came back a few minutes later to say that they didn‚Äôt have it so I had to pivot. I ended up ordering the bistro salad with chicken. Chicken was good but the salad was for sure not worth ordering. Chick pot pie leaned too soupy, but the wings and pretzel were pretty good.

author: Jennifer Rodela
text: Such a great find for lunch!  There was no waiting for a table.  The service was great.  The food was plentiful and delicious.  And the beer was cold.

author: David Cabral
text: Grabbed a burrito bowl, great portion size, and good flavor. Staff was polite and the atmosphere was fine. The space is very small so I‚Äôm sure during the season it won‚Äôt be easy to get in & out.

author: keegan donnelly
text:
After 2 days of travel, our family stopped in for a quick bite to eat and we really enjoyed it so much so, that we came back 2 days later for lunch.

Our second time in, I met Kasem who was very polite, knowledgeable, and his service was top tier. I appreciate his positivity as it seems rare to find in today‚Äôs day and age. The food was delicious and would highly recommend!  Will be back!

author: Shelly Oneil
text: This place is a hidden gem!! The burritos are so amazingly delicious and HUGE!! Once you have had one you will want one every week. I love that you can design your own flavorful burrito. Defiantly a must when  on the Vineyard

author: Andrew Jacobs
text: This is the best burrito I‚Äôve ever had in my entire life‚Ä¶tacos were killer too. Do it.

author: John Hyzak
text: 10/10 NO NOTES. La Choza is the only place I got for mex-style food since they opened a million years ago. Kassim (hope I‚Äôm spelling that right) was so incredibly kind and welcoming; my wife and I are absolutely demolishing these burritos right now, thank you my brother!!!

author: Nicole Jefferson
text: Was happy to find this place, when staying in MV during the off-season. Highly recommend! Food and service were amazing! Appreciated the staff accommodating us with all of our luggage. Will definitely come back again!

author: Rod T.
text: This is a nice little restaurant with a wide variety of offerings. Our server, Mary, was excellent - friendly, attentive, and helpful. The food was delicious and the atmosphere comfortable on a stormy December afternoon. Parking was challenging even though it was the off season, but the diner is worth the effort.

author: Teniecha C
text: Popped in here on an early Sunday afternoon. Went to the breakfast bar. Was quickly greeted and brought back my mimosa. The food (corned beef hash with fried eggs) came out quick and hot. No complaints about this place and will definitely return.

author: Leon Bailey
text:
What a great surprise to discover this place. Other visits of mine were when they were closed for whatever reason, but what a pleasant experience.
The meals coming out of the kitchen made my decision-making so much harder. Seeing so many great dishes left me wanting one of everything.
So, maybe I didn‚Äôt order the healthiest of breakfasts, but it was certainly delicious. What‚Äôs vacation for?

author: Bismark Aldana
text:
The best breakfast place on the island - no questions asked.  Visited this little gem a couple of times this year and I cannot wait to go back.

I had the spicy pulled pork hash which was seasoned and cooked to perfection.   My wife opted for the avacado toast with sunnies which she shared with me.  The kids loved their pancakes, and we also shared the bluberry SCONES which were a special of the day and they were, as you guess it, out of this world.

Great Little Gem that I wish I could take home with me.

Thanks G!

author: Bill M
text:
Stopped in for dinner and discovered the X-Tudo burger.  Holy cow was it delicious.   How they got; sweet corn, fried egg, ham, bacon, cheese, potato sticks, lettuce and tomatoes to fit under the bun with the 12oz burger is a feat!
But the taste was even better.  Who knew that sweet corn adds just a splash of extra flavor.
Highly recommend!
Picture doesn't do the wonderful flavor justice.
Friendly service too
And the place is nice and clean.

author: Victoria Oliveira UGC & Digital Mkt
text:
I came to Bobby‚Äôs B for the second time and unfortunately the service is terrible. One of the attendants, a short-haired, is extremely rude, with no kindness or professionalism at all. The food takes a long time to come out, and although it tastes very good, the service really ruins the experience.

Another huge issue is that there‚Äôs no bathroom available for customers. My 3-year-old son needed to use it urgently, and the only response we got was, ‚Äúit‚Äôs not working, it‚Äôs not working.‚Äù I was very upset, because he‚Äôs just a child and obviously cannot hold it the same way an adult can.

On top of that, the staff don‚Äôt even bring the food to the table ‚Äî customers have to go get it themselves ‚Äî and yet they still expect us to pay tips for such poor service.

This restaurant really needs to improve its customer service, because the food alone is not enough to make people want to come back.

author: Kathleen Campos
text: I bought this salad today ‚Äî besides being absurdly expensive, it was horrible, and nothing like the ingredients shown in the photo!! The croutons were so stale it was disgusting to eat!! Not to mention the chicken I paid extra for ‚Äî it came with four tiny pieces that looked more like a mix with the croutons, which were in excess just to cover up the lack of chicken!! And the amount of lettuce is minimal. It‚Äôs ridiculous to sell something like this for that price! My experience with this company is always bad, and I thought long and hard before buying this salad again, but hunger got the best of me and I gave this place one more chance ‚Äî and as expected, it was a horrible experience!! I also once bought a spoiled cake from here!

author: Martin Poulin
text: I ordered a cheeseburger, the waitress repeated the order as a steak bomb. I corrected her with my original request of a cheeseburger. When I got my order, they left out the cheese and charged me for the cheeseburger. I purchased a mini carrot cake that was totally stale. Looked really pretty but don‚Äôt eat it!!!  We wanted to eat there BUT it was too cold!

author: Prachi
text:
SKIP if you want an acai bowl.
$12 for frozen acai in a box, being sold as an acai bowl because the things that make it a bowl are a $1 EACH, as basic as granola and fruits
The bowl in the picture is $20, it's a small bowl with $1 each for toppings.

author: Meghan Murphy
text: We are thrilled with our decision to hire Mel and the team at Black Sheep to cater our 75-person wedding. The entire process - from the first call down to the last bite - was exceptional. Mel was extremely flexible, worked within our budget, and made us feel taken care of the entire time. The food was absolutely outstanding! We received countless compliments from our guests about everything from cocktail hour to the main course. Not only was the food delicious, but the portions were generous. The team also performed extremely well under weather challenges (the day featured torrential rain and wind). Highly, highly recommend Black Sheep for your next event!

author: Kyra MH
text: Don‚Äôt go here if you value your time & life. The slowest, most unorganized service. It took them 20 minutes to cut half a pound of turkey, unbelievable. Your better off ordering on ubereats

author: satjqy Trevino
text: I love everything about this shop !  The food is delicious and consistently good but also creative with new specials every day and the desserts are out of this world ! The store  is beautiful with lots of reasonably priced merchandise and best of all is the amazing staff that is always so helpful and makes you feel so welcome.

author: Meredith Nichols
text: We were so thankful to have Black Sheep as our wedding caterer for a ~150 person wedding with a tented dinner reception. We were so impressed by Mel and her staff and they were a key part in making our wedding day a success. Their service was very professional and the food was so delicious - we received so many positive comments on it, especially for the salmon and short ribs! The passed apps were really tasty too. We would recommend them to anyone in a heartbeat!

author: Amanda Rodell
text: Black Sheep catered our 75-person wedding, and were fantastic to work with. Our guests keep talking about how good the food was. Mel and her team were so organized and on top of everything throughout the planning and the big day. They made sure my husband and I got our food first, kept checking if we needed anything, and made the whole thing seamless. They even went the extra mile to make sure my gluten and dairy intolerant husband had apps and dinner he could eat. I can't recommend them highly enough.

restaurant_name: The Black Dog Bakery Caf√© (State St.)
author: Enid Meadows
text:
There is no one other than us in line, for the cake order.

The blonde pony tail female at the counter would not acknowledge us for next several minutes but when a man walked up to her and complained of the flooded bathroom, she gave him a full attention.

We chose to leave.

That is a bad traing of the employee. Hopefully we see the feedback next from the manager.

restaurant_name: The Black Dog Bakery Caf√© (State St.)
author: Joseph Evans
text: The Buffalo chicken loaded tots were outstanding, and the iced coffee was flawless. The cod fish sandwich was good, but the bread overshadowed the fish. I can't wait to return and explore more of the menu.

restaurant_name: The Black Dog Bakery Caf√© (State St.)
author: Juliet Marie
text: I truly enjoyed my first time experience at the Black Dog Bakery Cafe for lunch! The warmth and inviting atmosphere, coupled with friendly customer service, truly set the stage for an enjoyable visit. The unique and flavorful coffee surpassed my expectations leaving a lasting impression. The thoughtful display of merchandise and the dog-friendly ambiance add a charming touch for canine enthusiasts. The classic train car and outdoor seating provide a lovely setting for patrons to savor their meals. The Black Dog Bakery and Cafe is a gem with their deliciously rich peanut butter cups for gluten-free lovers, and irresistible cupcakes and other delicious homemade Bakery items. It's clear that The Black Dog Cafe has earned a special place in my list of favorite eateries.

restaurant_name: The Black Dog Bakery Caf√© (State St.)
author: Elle
text:
If you ever visit Martha‚Äôs Vineyard, I definitely suggest visiting the famous Black Dog Cafe. I wasn‚Äôt a fan of the wings but the lobster roll, crab cakes and calamari was good. The highlight was definitely the cocktails and the cute mason jars.

In terms of decor and ambiance , the space feels homely and cozy with a gorgeous patio. I would definitely recommend coming here for a chill date or afternoon outing with friends or family.

The staff was friendly and the wait time was short.

restaurant_name: The Black Dog Bakery Caf√© (State St.)
author: B Lipka
text: We stopped in for some hot tea.  They serve organic tea and lots of baked goods and dog treats. The atmosphere was relaxing, the staff were friendly and an enjoyable time. The sweet treats were excellent. No allergen items offered.

author: Jeanne Barron
text: CHARMING FRENCH FLAVOR. MENU RELIES ON OLD STYLE EUROPEAN PRESENTATIONS AND MENU ITEMS LIKE BEEF WELLINGTON, COQ AU VIN, ETC. FEELS LIKE STEPPING BACK 25 YEARS, KIND OF FUN.

author: chris ellis
text: very good

author: sarah loverink
text: Pass on this one.

author: John L
text:
Take out order.  Nice staff.  Fresh ingredients.  My party ordered the following:
- Chirashi
- Spicy Salmon Roll
- Spicy Yellowtail Roll
- Spicy Scallop Roll

Thanks to the business owner‚Äôs prompt response to my feedback!üôÇ

author: Tyler Darby
text: If I lived on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard all summer, I would eat here every day.   Great vibe.  Great food.  Great service.   You must get the Tiger roll !

author: C
text: A wide variety of  Asian cuisine for the menu and is open year round on the island! Great customer service! Great ambiance and vibes at the restaurant. I really enjoyed the chicken wings and sushi that were ordered. The fish is good quality and fresh! My favorite was the spicy scallop hand roll! Everything is on point and highly recommend. Spacious dining area. There is street parking and within walking distance to other retails and beautiful view in the area. I highly recommend!

author: Michelle Lin
text: Ordered take out and the lady that accompanied me was very patient(since I‚Äôm very indecisive), and sweet. Really appreciate that, food tasted very fresh and amazing. The atmosphere in the store was beautiful, Definitely trying out dine in next time!

author: Juliet Marie
text:
I recently dined at Mikado, and the experience was nothing short of exceptional! From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere was warm and inviting, setting the perfect tone for a delightful meal. The restaurant exudes cleanliness and attention to detail, creating a comfortable environment for diners.

The service at Mikado was truly outstanding. The staff was attentive, courteous, and entertained conversation, I sat in the bar area, which made the dining experience even more enjoyable. They were prompt in taking orders and ensured that everything was to my satisfaction.

One of the highlights for me was the soothing background music that enhanced the overall ambiance. It created a relaxing atmosphere, allowing me to savor my meal in a peaceful setting.

I opted for the floral green tea, and I must say, the flavor is delightful! The tea had a subtle, yet distinct, floral note that complemented the meal perfectly.

As for the main course, I chose the Kung Pao chicken, and it didn't disappoint! The dish was expertly prepared, with the perfect balance of spicy and savory flavors. The chicken was tender, and the accompanying vegetables were fresh and crisp, showcasing the chef's skill and attention to quality ingredients.

Overall, my visit to Mikado was a memorable one, thanks to its excellent service from Cindy, pristine environment, inviting ambiance, and delicious offerings. I would highly recommend this restaurant to future visitors seeking a top-notch dining experience.

author: Margaret Caroccia
text: Absolutely amazing food!  We came back twice ‚Ä¶ ceviche unbelievable taste and value, fig and prosciutto pizza, apple crisp - super yummy.  Brown sugar steak tips and braised lamb shank the next time - so wonderful we couldn‚Äôt order a pizza to take home as planned.  Great place with lots of locals and bartenders that can make drinks not on the menu!

author: K Rosa
text:
Interesting place. A full sized bowling alley (6ish lanes) and a nice little restaurant.
We sat at the bartop for our steak & eggs brunch. The bartender was friendly not but overly engaging. Watching her and the other waitstaff their teamwork made for efficient service.
When we were brought our meal and I set my eyes on the steak, I was a little concerned about the quality. It looked like something that would be served from one of the American chain restaurants (Chili's, Applebees, etc.). I was

author: Madison ‚ÄúMadii‚Äù
text: I picked this place since it seemed like a good sit-down restaurant in Oak Bluffs. Honestly, I was expecting bowling alley food because of the bowling alley, but it was quite nice! The servers were kind and one with lots of humor lol. I got the shrimp linguni and it was good, I just prefer my sauce a bit more creamy.  Good place for the family.

author: Donna D'Aquino
text: Food was awesome! Best so far on our vacation! Great portions and great service!

author: Garrick
text:
Who knew a bowling alley could have such great food?

We were skeptical when we were told how good the food is at Barn Bowl & Bistro, but having been there about a dozen times now, we're convinced. They serve up great dishes with consistency and at a reasonable price for the Island.

Most recently I had their Brazilian churrasco bbq...where they come to your table with skewers of meat and slice off what you want. At $34.99, it's an awesome deal for some delicious meats. It comes with three sides: rice, a salsa of sorts, and a third dish which I didn't catch the name of but was quite tasty. Currently, they're talking about offering it on Saturdays - maybe Fridays - so call first. And go support them so they continue to serve it up!

Other suggestions...the shrimp and sausage pasta is great as are the pizzas. I haven't had the curry but friends have and thoroughly enjoyed it. Personally, I've had the scallops, Bang Bang Cauliflower, SW Chicken Egg Rolls, and the Fried Fishermans Platter - which can serve two. All are good. A lot of folks tout the fried chicken but the night my husband had it, it wasn't well seasoned. And rumor has it there might be better fish and chips elsewhere.

The restaurant is clean and comfortable. The staff is awesome and they mix great drinks. All in all, it's an establishment we'll continue to enjoy and support.

Oh, and the bowling is great too!

author: Scott Scheleur
text: Fresh seafood market that also has cooked food to order.  No inside seating, but several picnic tables with umbrellas outside to sit at or do take-away. We got an order of the fish tacos and the shrimp tacos. Each order comes with two tacos ‚Äì very fully filled. Wonderful sauce and toppings (contained corn, peppers, tomatoes, onions, black beans ‚Äì be aware if you don‚Äôt like all those type of things) on both. Shrimp and fish were fresh and were perfectly cooked and seasoned. Good value for Vineyard Haven.

author: Paul Vivas
text:
We had a lunch here in the Net Result and really enjoyed it. It actually is a shop too but you can buy food inside or at the windows and have it on the table outside.
Fairly priced so we were positively surprised as MV can be really expensive. This place comes highly recommended from us!

author: Lisa DeWitt
text:
Travellers, the net result is a seafood take-out restaurant with a fish store inside. Or the fish store also serves take out food. Which ever is the case give this a try. The flounder sandwich is wonderful. The fish is fresh and perfectly fried lightly and then stuffed into the bun. All the fried foods are fresh and delicious. The seafood is amazing too. The real stars are the ready to go soups and items that are made in house and stock the shelves. The lobster bisque is fantastic. A sandwich, lobster bisque, and the gorgeous sunsets is all anyone really needs. Check it out. We recommend.

TLDR excellent fried and fresh seafood

author: Mark Ledbetter
text: We've spend a couple short holiday's on Martha's Vineyard and a top priority stop for us is a dinner from The Net Result. Whether you are eating it right there at the picinic tables or packing it to go you can't go wrong. Best to get there a bit early to avoid long lines and waits, but you won't be disappointed.

author: Emeris Pendragon
text:
Half of the clams in the steamer bag were unopened and clearly not safe to eat.
The handful of clams that safely opened after steaming had an off color.
The inside market area has a funky smell, not confidence inducing when eating seafood.
My cousin said his fish & chips were the worst he has ever had.
The staff also rolls their eyes if you ask for extra sauces or have questions.

I would avoid this place like the plague.

author: Ben Roth
text: An excellent spot to grab snacks for the beach, a souvenir to take home, or even a meal after a day spent exploring the Island. It‚Äôs near South Beach, and I was thankful to stumble upon it after riding my bike from West Tisbury, enjoying the beach, and then heading up your way Edgartown. There‚Äôs everything you‚Äôd expect to find at a general store, along with a counter-service kitchen where you can get a great lobster roll, a smoothie, and more. While it is expensive, it‚Äôs not out of line compared with other spots on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. They have a nice little outdoor dining area to enjoy if you don‚Äôt want to take it to go. While I didn‚Äôt get a souvenir, the T-shirts they sell taught me how to properly pronounce Katama, the cherry on top for me!

author: Amy Glazer
text: Johnny knocks it out of the park with the finest lobster roll I have ever tasted! From the brioche bun to huge chunks of sweet, fresh lobster‚Ä¶ a sublime combination! The best bites on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard, and well worth the drive to Katama. üôèüèº

author: Patrick Dugan
text: I remember when this place was barely a shack on the way to South Beach. Now, it's been immensely upgraded and offers everything from souvenirs and gifts to food...even sushi! But by far the best reason to stop is their lobster roll, which is the best I've ever enjoyed...tons of lobster on a brioche bun. A bargain at $32 (the price can vary).

author: Liam Connolly
text:
Hands down the best lobster roll on the island, simplicity executed to perfection. Johnny is clearly some sort of magician.

Also the ideal stop for beer on the way to South Beach.

author: Farid B
text: The best burger and lobster roll we‚Äôve had on MV. My toddler (who my wife fears is vegetarian) couldn‚Äôt get enough of the burger. The double pattie smash burger is well cooked and the toasted potato bun is perfect. While they‚Äôre not giving away the lobster roll, they are generous with the meat and the bun is nice and crispy. Two members of the family said it was their favorite lobster roll ever, one said it was his second favorite.

author: mitchell pachico
text: Amazing sandwiches and pizza also have take home dinners available chic. Parm lasagna ext highly recommend giving them a try

author: Jenna Gavula
text: The pizza was fantastic!!!! I'm not much of a seafood person and a redditor said this was THE best pizza on the island and they weren't lying. Nice thin crisp crust, perfect ratio of sauce, cheese and toppings. I would visit MV just for this pizza and I'm coming from PA. The staff was great and the place stayed busy!

author: Jillian B
text: I had a very unpleasant experience at Rocco's Pizzeria. It was not open yet, and I wasn't getting food there. I was sitting with my dog on the deck surrounding Rocco's one morning, waiting for my family, as they were grabbing drinks at a nearby coffee shop. A man suddenly burst through a side door near the pizza place, and I am assuming it was the owner of Rocco's himself. He immediately started lecturing me in an aggressive tone about how my dog was not allowed on the deck. He barely let me get an apology in as he just about chased me off the deck. He continued to go off about how allowing dogs in outdoor areas costs extra money for him (not true), and how he doesn't like dogs, so I needed to leave immediately. The interaction was completely unnecessary. I would have gladly walked away with no issue if he had approached me in a friendlier manner. I understand pets are not allowed within food preparation areas, but I had no idea that included outdoor spaces. I used to enjoy Rocco's Pizza, but I will not be returning after this incident. It was so rude, and no one should be spoken to that way, especially a potential customer. It also says a lot that this guy that he doesn't like dogs.

author: Keri McCarthy
text: Rocco‚Äôs was great! My daughter ordered a GF pizza and they promised us it would be great. It was - and she‚Äôs 14 and has lots of opinions, so that‚Äôs saying a lot! Definitely homemade crust. The regular pizza was delicious too and the people working there were super nice and helpful. We would visit again.

author: Chris Harrington
text:
Wow, excellent thin crust pizza

Update 9/26/22
This continues to be my favorite pizza, not just on the island but in all of Massachusetts.

author: Nick
text: As of July 24th 2025 the course is in good shape unlike some reviews from last year.   You can see where they‚Äôve replaced a bunch of the greens.  I was definitely skeptical about coming based on the recent reviews but overall it was a good experience.  Not the best mini golf course I‚Äôve ever played but had a great time with the fam nonetheless.  Biggest complaint is the holes are uneven so the ball rolls back sometimes or gets stuck up against the wall.  $12 for adults and $10 for kids.

author: Salvadore McNamara
text: Used to come here as a kid when it had different ownership and it was usually, as I recall, a pleasant and clean experience. It‚Äôs still pleasant but it seems like they haven‚Äôt drained or cleaned the pools in a long time. The greens are in decent condition but a lot of the indicator signs are frequently missing. Maybe that‚Äôs part of the charm? The lack of lighting on the back holes could be conducive to skunks or other mischief. I had a nice time and it‚Äôs definitely a good bang for my buck on this island that loves to take my money.

author: Jason Levy
text: It needs a lot of attention.  See pics from yesterday, ripped up greens, rotted wood throughout, holes where wood used to be.  Teenage employees were friendly though.

author: Harman Stinson
text: The putting surface is so worn out on 90% of the holes it is like putting on concrete. This place has been around for many years and they have probably put in zero money into maintaining the course. Basically the putting surface is so worn out that everybody's ball ends up in the lowest part of the hole everytime. Honestly if they don't put some money into the course they should just close down.

author: Elio Silva
text:
had a great time with my 9 year old daughter.
Come on over and bring the whole family

author: Evangeline Earl
text: Got the clam chowder, it was sooo delish! Lots of clams in it! Great customer service, super friendly staff. The staff mentioned they have a nightclub upstairs with live music‚Äî if you‚Äôre staying in Oak Bluffs come here for chowder, good drinks, & maybe stay late-night for the music scene.

author: Ar Monsanto
text: The food was really good. We set immediately but it took a very long time to receive the food. However, the food did not disappoint. The lobster roll is hands down THE BEST!

author: Nicole C.
text: Always great food. Truly best chowder in our opinion, the lobster bisque is delicious and very buttery as well. Love the south beach cocktail. Our server Igor was incredibly friendly and truly topped off our experience as wonderful! An island vacation staple!

author: Meera Bhan
text: Cannot recommend the lobster rolls here. Meat isn‚Äôt the best cuts and not fresh. We also found shells in it. The roll is also drenched in butter. I prefer when places give you butter on the side to add to taste. I would stick to the chowder, which is what this place specializes in.

author: Gabriel Pag√°n
text: This is our go to place when we visit Martha‚Äôs Vineyard the food and service is always amazing. I‚Äôve had lobster rolls from many different places and my wife and kids agree that this is the best lobster rolls we ever had. Lobster is always fresh and they don‚Äôt skimp out on the quantity. That roll is stacked! üòã

author: Alesha Moraes Ramos
text:
We had such an amazing experience at Sharky‚Äôs! My pregnant sister came all the way from the Netherlands to visit me here on the Vineyard, and all she could talk about was the nachos from Sharky‚Äôs. She hadn‚Äôt had them in over 7 years, but they were her absolute favorite back then, and this visit definitely did not disappoint.

We ordered the Loaded Nachos, Chicken Bacon ranch Quesadillas, and Wings, and everything was delicious and satisfying. The nachos were just as she remembered: crispy, cheesy, and loaded. The quesadillas were packed with flavor and grilled perfectly, and the wings were hot, crispy, and juicy.

The food came out quickly, the staff was super friendly, and the whole atmosphere was fun and casual, perfect for a memorable meal with family. Sharky‚Äôs truly made our reunion special. Highly recommend!

author: Taras Martiniouk
text: Is it the place to be, absolutely not, is it a gimmick that‚Äôs fun and cool for kids but also a great food happy hour 4-6 yes. Will I be craving sharks ever ? No, but when it‚Äôs late and everything is closed it is definitely the move !

author: Munther
text:
Sharky‚Äôs Cantina in Oak Bluffs is a must-visit if you‚Äôre on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard! The food is consistently delicious, thanks to the incredible talents of Tass, the chef. The nachos, in particular, are outstanding‚Äîloaded with fresh toppings, perfectly melted cheese, and just the right amount of spice. Whether you‚Äôre sharing with friends or indulging on your own, they‚Äôre a must-try!

What truly sets this place apart, though, is the service. Anna, our waiter, was exceptional. She was attentive, friendly, and made sure our dining experience was top-notch from start to finish. Her recommendations were spot on, and she went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.

The lively atmosphere, combined with the fantastic food‚Äîespecially those nachos‚Äîand outstanding service from Tass and Anna, makes Sharky‚Äôs Cantina a standout spot in Oak Bluffs. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

author: Shivi D.
text:
I think this place gets worse every time I go there. Ordered boneless wings last night and they were so over cooked and dry. The picture does no justice in how dark and over fried the meat was.
The staff is always bunched up at the computer talking to each other and no one even greets you as you walk through the door. You just have to awkwardly break up their conversation to ask for your food. Every time.

author: Daniel Rancourt
text: Food was good. Had a Chimichanga it was flavored well, but the rice a little bland. Just did takeout so can't say much about atmosphere. It just seemed comfortable.  The service was prompt and pleasant.   Oh and the loaded cheese tater tots is awesome.

author: Tyler Darby
text: Love the long communal table.  I had the scallion pancake with sausage.   My friend had the avocado toast.  You can‚Äôt go wrong with anything on the menu.  The coffee was fantastic as well.   I had an iced vanilla latte. This would definitely be a regular spot if I just wasn‚Äôt in on a short trip.

author: Maggie Moyers
text: This place is the BEST!! Amazing food and the pastries are out of this world. As someone who doesn‚Äôt usually go for the sweets, the blueberry muffin is one of my favorite items here! I also tried the avocado toast and the full Monty breakfast sandwich‚Ä¶ unreal with the hash browns inside the sandwich! Like whattttttt. My husband got the breakfast burrito and loved it! Coming back here everyday of my vacation!

author: matthew cosby
text: This place is fantastic! Everything I've eaten at S & S has been 10/10 A+. They make some of the best pastries I've ever had. I would highly recommend trying their house made blueberry muffins, cinnamon rolls and/or yummy scones. I'm not even a scone guy and these things blew me away. The chocolate chip and with vanilla glaze is a total standout. The vibe of the place is great too... perfect for a quick pop in or stay a while and people watch through their wall to wall windows. There's always plenty of seating and the staff is friendly and professional as well! #bigfan

author: Heather Kouveras
text: Did you think you'd come to MV and find a Rap Scallion pancake with house made kim chi? Or a breakfast sandwich with house made sausage? Great coffee drinks, friendly service, and cute ambiance all make this a new favorite.

author: Colleen Garrett
text: Was going to try to gate-keep this place but they deserve this review, the world needs to know! This is my favorite quick food spot on the island. Best ambience, great coffee and I got the Cesar salad wrap and it‚Äôs truly the best Cesar wrap I‚Äôve had in my entire life. Best place on Main Street for breakfast/lunch!

author: Ron Rogers
text:
The service is stellar. The ambiance is upscale yet comfortable.

The food is not quite as good. We ordered raw oysters 4/5, fried calamari with banana peppers 3/5 (more calamari less banana peppers, even though the peppers was the tastiest part), chicken sandwich 5/5, and catch of the day scallops with risotto 4/5, and Dubai cheese cake 3/5.

Good cocktail, beer, and wine choices.

author: Nataliya Podlozhnyuk
text: Had to eat here twice on our time on the island because we wanted our last dinner to be just as good as our first! 10/10 food. Everything we tried was incredible. Tried the two specials. Scallops and fluke as well as the corn side. Preparation was great, flavor wasn‚Äôt lacking. All dishes were 10/10. The second night my fluke specifically lacked as much sauce as I had the first but it was still very flavorful (posted both pictures and realized how much bigger the second fish was to the first night üòÖ) . The portions for the fluke are HUGE. You will not be disappointed eating here.

author: Jane Ma Nolan
text:
This place is clearly very popular because there was a queue outside the restaurant before it opened for 5:30 p.m. dinner service on a very rainy Saturday night. Once open, the restaurant quickly filled up with diners. Tables tend to be closer together because of how busy it gets, and there are a lot of hard surfaces, meaning things can get a little loud.

Service was the right level of attentive: staff were very friendly and they were good about clearing plates and utensils when it‚Äôs clear diners are done eating. The daily fish specials are posted on a chalkboard inside.

Overall, the food was very good. The buffalo brussel sprouts with whipped blue cheese were very good but for $18? Feels steep. My husband enjoyed his tuna, which was served like an elevated poke bowl and had Asian influences. I got the seared cut cod special, and enjoyed the sweet corn and mushroom risotto that came on the side: it was appropriately warm and cozy feeling for the rainy day, and brightened by the bursts of sweet freshness from the corn.

author: Corey Patricia Thomas
text: LOVE this spot. The food was amazing! And Molly, our waitress, was amazing. Our drinks came out super fast and the food was delicious!!!!! Highly recommend the Port Hunter.

author: Kimberly Bernstein
text:
Great experience. I‚Äôm vegan and they provided me with many options (which aren‚Äôt all listed on the menu - so feel free to ask).
They ran out of high chairs, and made the effort to go across the street to their sister restaurant to get one for our daughter.
Service was excellent and food was delicious.
10/10

author: Kathleen McDonough
text: We stopped in for breakfast and it was bustling inside even though it was off season. Hubby ordered bacon scrambled eggs and gluten free toast. I ordered the breakfast scrambler with American cheese instead of provolone cheese and a grilled English muffin. It was a cute little downtown location and the servers all work together to take care of customers. The food was good and came out really quick. We are glad we stopped in.

author: antoinette rodney
text: I ate here three times for breakfast while on the island. If I had discovered this place sooner, I would have eaten here every day. The fact that they have perfected the art of getting the pancakes to your table while they are piping hot deserves 5 stars. The pancakes are also so good! They remind me of what IHOP used to be when I was growing up. Ask for maple syrup if you prefer that. I wish I lived closer to this spot because it would be my local favorite ‚ù§Ô∏è.

author: Micah Lubensky
text: We had a memorable dinner here last weekend. The food was excellent; Kay (our server) was professional, thorough, efficient, charmingly funny, and warm; the setting is quaint; and we were happy to support a Black-owned business. We shared the Buffalo chicken spring rolls (surprisingly good), and each had a side Caesar salad and fish and chips. The fish and chips were a very large portion that we couldn‚Äôt finish after the spring rolls and side salads. We took the leftovers home and ate them the next day and it was still delicious.

author: Lakisha Bah
text: I patronized this business on October 30th around 6:30pm. When I arrived, I immediately was greeted with lackluster customer service - from the host and especially from my waitress (throughout the night she kept asking did I want a to go box). I ordered the fish cakes for appetizer- it was good. I ordered the oxtails with rice and beans and cabbage - it was not good. When it came out, it looked overcooked.  The meat was tender, but the taste was awful  - the food had no flavor and the meat had a funny taste to it - like it was cleaned with dishwashing soap. I could not eat it. I then just ordered the sweet potato cheesecake- that was good. Well, apparently what I did eat of the oxtails gave me food poisoning.  Around midnight that night I was vomiting off and on the food til that morning with diarrhea!  I can not nor will I visit that establishment again!

author: Ropl
text:
Looks like a local favorite.  Friendly servers and customers.

Fish and chips with side of slaw was a reasonable $18.  Bottomless coffee/tea $3 more.  The cod was hot and flaky, excellent.

Quite busy during meal time

author: Elizabeth Richardson
text: Really cute market with high quality meats and seafood, pre-made sides, some baked goods, packaged snacks, fresh veggies, charcuterie goods, beer, wine. Really has it all for a beach day!

author: Shored Up Digital
text:
As a marketing team constantly on the move, Edgartown Meat & Fish is our MVP. The sushi is hands-down the perfect grab-and-go lunch: fresh, consistent, and ready when we are between shoots and meetings. Their wine selection is a lifesaver for client gifting: great labels at a range of price points, plus helpful staff who can point you to exactly the right bottle. And when the day runs long, the prepared foods case makes dinner effortless; think flavorful mains, solid sides, and salads that actually hold up.

Service is quick, the store is organized, and you can check off lunch, gifts, and dinner in one stop. For busy locals and island visitors alike, this place just works. OH AND do not forget the Starbucks inside the market for all your energy needs!

author: Marnely Murray
text: This is your one stop shop on island!  As someone that lives in Edgartown year round, I appreciate having a market like them open through the winter. Reasons why I love it: they have well stocked shelves of essentials but also fun pantry items - if you want to make any kind of ethnic food, they have sauces and spices to go with your meal. Their meat and seafood cases are always packed with deliciousness. Try their steak tips on the grill, you will fall in love! They also sell side dishes that are great for when you need to put together a quick dinner. Need ice cream? They've got it. Fresh mushrooms and vegetables? They have them! Freshly made sushi rolls? YES! Frozen fried onion rings? Yup, they have them! Plus wine and beer, a Starbucks outpost for everyone the needs their SB hit from time to time, plus they carry so many local products like MV Sea Salt and Val Cakes desserts and Not Your Sugar Mamas coffee. Overall, just an awesome market and the owners are local to the island and the nicest people ever, the staff is so friendly and always helpful!

author: Kathy Skelton
text: Ummm‚Ä¶ my 3 stars may be a little off because it‚Äôs not exactly what I was looking for.  There was definitely more meat than fish.

author: Lis Bluford
text: Always delighted by the well curated selection here. Top tier meat, great seafood options - this is such a reliable staple to the community. I love that they support local bakers, they have starbucks drinks, their produce is always fresh...I am always looking for a reason to pop in for one thing and leave with 10 extra goodies!

author: Morgan Fykes
text: I had a wonderful meal here at the the bar with some friends.  The food was delicious, the drinks were well made and the bartender was funny and knowledgeable.  Its definitely one of my favorite places to get a delicious meal on the island and I can't wait to go back! We had a mix of dishes from the grilled octopus to some agnolotti that had us ready to lick the plate.  Salad and fish along with a sticky toffee desert that I could eat all day.

author: Elizabeth Richardson
text:
Environment was on point. Service was surprisingly sub par for such a nice spot. Our server was good, but others didn't seem to quite understand restaurant etiquette.
Scallop dish was yummy with the pomegranate seeds.
Octopus was a bit charred, as was the focaccia but still pretty tasty. Pork belly was amazing.

author: Thomas Rollins
text: Excellent restaurant in Oak Bluff. We started with the Negroni with Balsamic. Delicious. We share the focaccia, the mussels and mafalde. Each was wonderful. For mains, we  had the sea scallops, tautog and pork chops. Each dish was fantastic and enjoyed by all. I highly recommend.

author: Robert H.
text: We‚Äôve only been in MV for 2 days but everything was so good I‚Äôm having a hard time thinking we will find better.  Our server Ashly was super friendly and attentive A++

author: Emily Saucedo Faoro
text: Great food and drink! Had a fabulous solo lunch while visiting Oak Bluffs. Nick was so wonderful and made this visit worthwhile.

author: A. M.
text:
We were there off session, in late March, which I'm sure the speed and service efficiency is different from summer months.

The Fall veggie melt on facoccia bread, the turkey bacon wrap, the pastrami sandwich, the vegetarian chili, and he onion soup were delicious.  The chocolate chip, peanut butter, and the sugar cookies were delicious, too.

The service was quick and efficient.  You can place your order ahead of time on the phone and avoid waiting in line.

author: Nicholas Miles
text: 7a in Tisbury is a culinary gem that consistently delivers a delightful dining experience. The moment you step in, the aroma of their scrumptious offerings envelops you. The sandwiches are a true standout, bursting with fresh ingredients and imaginative combinations that cater to every palate. Their salads are equally impressive, showcasing a medley of flavors and textures that leave a lasting impression. And don't even get me started on the desserts ‚Äì they're a delectable finale that's worth saving room for. With each bite, you can taste the care and creativity that goes into crafting their menu. 7a is a must-visit for anyone seeking a delicious meal on the island.

author: Laura Laura
text: Solid place to grab a quick sandwich when you are in the area. Love the pulled pork and turkey BLT. It can get pretty busy in the summer, but I always try to stop by.

author: Marnely Murray
text:
7aFood is truly such a gem on Martha's Vineyard! Locally and family owned, I love supporting this spot! Their sandwiches are some of the best on island, their Liz Lemon is truly spectacular. Their soups are so so good and tasty delicious!

Plus, I always grab a coffee when I am in the area, plus a bag of my favorite Chilmark Coffee beans as well!

author: DeVita Chiropractic
text: Best breakfast up island!!! Breakfast sandwich on the jalape√±o cheddar biscuit is the way to go. Best oatmeal I‚Äôve ever had, something magical about the maple brown butter.

author: Ron Rogers
text: Busy little place. Clean and bright with vibrant artwork. The service is friendly and fast. We ordered IN DA Club 4.5/5 and CheeseSteak Bomb 5/5.

author: Shored Up Digital
text:
Tigerhawk Sandwich Shop in OB is an absolute must-visit for sandwich lovers on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. This spot takes craft sandwiches to the next level, using fresh, high-quality ingredients and bold flavors that make every bite unforgettable. The menu is packed with creative, chef-driven sandwiches, from house-roasted meats to perfectly balanced vegetarian options, all served on awesome bread.

The vibe is laid-back and welcoming - owners Rachel and Jimmy are truly the best, making it the perfect place to grab a quick lunch, takeout for the beach, or a satisfying meal after exploring the island If you‚Äôre looking for the best sandwiches on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard, Tigerhawk is the place to go!

author: K P
text: The Tiger Fried Chicken Sandwich was absolutely amazing ‚Äî the perfect balance of sweet, spicy, and salty. The portion was generous for the price, and it came out quickly. I also appreciated that while tipping was an option, they didn‚Äôt automatically tack on a fee when I online ordered, like many places do now. Everything on the menu sounded unique and full of flavor, and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

author: Ropl
text:
Alright service was 5 stars, friendly and efficient.
Food 4 stars cause I'm more used to the traditional Vietnamese banh mi that uses baguette as they were french influenced.
Originally came for their poke bowl but they have no tuna on hand, so a little disappointed.
Switched to banh mi with pork belly $16+tax.  By now I'm quite used to the higher prices in MV.
4 pieces of square inch or so flavorful pork bellies in a sub sandwich (again baguette would give more crunch) with fresh cucumber slices, pickled jalapenos, cilantro, almost invisible shredded carrots& sauteed onions.  Not bad though sandwich became soggy towards the end with the dressing inside.  Their table top haberneo/pineapple hot sauce was wonderful to add for kicking it up a notch.

author: Igor Vukoje
text: I just had The best vegan (grilled tofu & shiitake) sandwich of my life. Definitely worth of visiting! If you are in Oak Bluffs and looking for a quick lunch, Tigerhawk is a must!

author: Paul Fosler
text: Maybe the best Italian sandwich of my life. Not super fast‚Ä¶ but super good. We ate it so quick only got a picture once I nearly finished. Roast beef was 4.5 star.

author: Marnely Murray
text: I've had probably ten meals at Mo's already since they opened and I just love it so much. The people, the vibes, the service, the food, the love, the creativity! The sandwiches are saucy and delicious, the desserts are like a hug to your heart, the onion rings are outrageous, and you can sit outdoors and enjoy the weather even on cool fall days! Seriously support them - they are incredible community members and the food is LEGIT!

author: Austin Davis
text:
Staying in MV for the week, and saw this was across from the house I‚Äôm in. It‚Äôs AMAZING! It was hard choosing between the sandwiches, and I really want to go back for salads and tinned fish.

Got to sit on the couch in the back by the N64, also an added bonus. Plus the staff were super friendly and helped us decide what to order. Pictured are the filet-o-fish, hot beef sandwich, waffle fries, and the oatmeal chocolate cookie.

author: Lis Bluford
text: This is the first place I want to get food from on the island because I know it's going to exceed my expectations. Creative specials, the best baked goods on the island, hearty portions and great value. Easy in/out too with a loyal local following.

author: W Miller
text: I had read about Mo's, located inside the Portuguese American Club, Oak Bluffs, being a hidden gem. It was our first stop and first dining experience on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside was warm and welcoming. Our lunch consisted of a cauliflower melt and roast pork sandwich. Outstanding! Note... they do offer free water, I didn't notice until after I had bought a water. Make sure you grab a cookie, the size of your head, before you head out! My pick lemon sugar!! Thank you for a delicious lunch Mo's, we are looking forward to seeing you the next time we are on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard!

author: Juelles Santiago
text: I‚Äôve tried to give this caf√© multiple chances because the food is good, but the staff‚Äôs attitude is consistently unprofessional. On my most recent visit, I was made to feel unwelcome ‚Äî laughing among staff, cold body language, and a dismissive tone toward customers. As a paying customer, I expect basic courtesy and respect, and unfortunately that has not been my experience here. I will not be returning until customer service improves.

author: Marina Kofman
text: CLAMBAKE GALORE!!! Fella's catered my brother's destination wedding welcome dinner. We were looking for something casual, inviting, local & of course tasty. Boy did Fella deliver! 2 months later, the guests are still talking about the most delicious lobster they've ever had. The whole family was EXTREMELY accommodating to this very last minute wedding, during Covid and us having to change adjust time/location of the event a few times. The whole team was organized & pleasant. And let's not forget the homemade brownies as a perfect finisher to this scrumptious meal. It was the most perfect evening. Thank you Fella's!

author: Drew Cosgrove
text: Fella catered our rehearsal dinner many years ago. He did his signature clambake. Both families are old New England families who know what a clambake is.  From Great Grandma to the little ones, everyone was astonished at how good the food was. Lobster was perfectly cooked and seasoned, the clam packs were awesome! We heard many times how "...this brings back so many memories of how we used to do these on the beach when we were kids."  The staff was perfectly attentive and the amount of food for the price left a smile on the face of my family.  Great value but even better food! You will not be disappointed unless you are one of those folks who leave a 2 star rating because there wasn't soy, almond, and coconut options for the after dinner latte with no foam, non fat, no flavor coffee.

author: Elite H. Construction
text: Great staff,, great food and always a great service. Keep up the good work guys and ladies üëèüòé

author: Alexander Dimovich
text: I Would not recommend. Tried out the Italian and a burger. Italian was lack luster and drenched in dressing. Burger was a small over cooked and flavorless premade patty and for $11 you would expect a side of fries. Staff was also unfriendly. Will not be coming back.

author: AI Glasses
text: This is a solid restaurant with good food. The generous pour of wine and great atmosphere is something to be repeated. Young toddlers played outside and older adults chatted with friends. The food was fresh and the olive oil cake brought back great memories.

author: DJ Garcia
text:
This place could get more stars!!

We made State Road our first stop once getting to MV and were fortunate to get a spot at the bar - we had no reservations.

The food was perfect and full of flavor. There are too many good things to say for one review. The only negative is that fine dining establishments like this one give small portions and I left hungry.

If you ever come to MV this is a must eat restaurant. As good as any place I‚Äôve been in my life. Flawless experience

author: Jack Murphy
text: One of the best spots on the island and one of the more memorable meals I've had in Massachusetts in a long time. The food was wonderful, the beverage program was spot on, they keep it local, seasonal, and exciting. Strongly recommend!

author: Michael Chmielewski
text: Consistently an excellent choice on the island.  Interesting and inventive seasonal menus never disappoint.  Top notch quality ingredients including local farm fresh seasonal vegg.  The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable yet upscale. In the fall/winter it's a special treat to sit near the roaring fireplace.  Service is professional, quick and attentive.   Large and appealing wine list.  Our most recent visit was in the shoulder season (Oct).  Nice bottle of Pouilly-Fuisse to start. Simply Roasted Carrots and PEI Mussels were the highlight starters along with the Bread Board.  Stand out mains were the Cast Iron Seared Scallops (butternut sq puree, spinach, quinoa, green apple, cilantro, sesame, yuzu vinaigrette) and the Grilled Swordfish (carrot-ginger mash, broccoli rabe, fennel cilantro blood orange  salad and black eyed peas).  Affogato all around for dessert, though from past experience we know the Olive Oil Cake and Chocolate Terrine and both excellent as well.  State Road is one if the best restaurants on the island.  Highly recommend.  Expensive by MV standards, yet not the most expensive on the island.  Our meal was worth the price.

author: Ian Wallace
text: Definitely make a reservation. Very well crafted space with curtains and hidden lighting. The Hen of the woods with soubise I could eat for hours! Focaccia is good to share and unique. Carrots weren't really developed they're just sorta soft carrots :/ could roast them slower and longer. Panda cup sake was super good like alcohol but smooth coconut water. The lamb had no taste it was like everything else on the plate had a voice but the lamb was just texture with grilledness.. It was expertly cooked though.

restaurant_name: Pie in the Sky Bakery & Cafe
author: MarkM3110
text: This is one of the nicest coffee shop I've been in. The place is just cool to sit and sip. There's also a menu for those who likes to sip and bite. Definitely must try whenever passing through.

restaurant_name: Pie in the Sky Bakery & Cafe
author: Morgan Fykes
text: We needed a little something before we hit the road so we went and got a deluxe smash burger to split which was delicious üòã (burger with Swiss, bacon and BBQ sauce, we left the sauce off).  I would definitely order this burger üçî again!! I also got the raspberry shortbread bar and LOVED it.

restaurant_name: Pie in the Sky Bakery & Cafe
author: Alex Hill
text:
Amazing set up. I came in January so outdoor seating was not a realistic option. Luckily there were some seats inside. The decor is tasteful seacoast.

I ordered a coffee (amazing) and a New England clam chowder. I was hungry but it may have been the best chowder I've ever had. We also got a pecan pie and a very excited to try it.

Small businesses like this on the coast are what make the cape special. Do yourself a favor and come visit.

restaurant_name: Pie in the Sky Bakery & Cafe
author: Samuel Ainscough
text: We visited randomly whilst driving around Falmouth. What a place! Relatively small, but we really appreciated the quirky interior and the delicious coffee and gorgeous pumpkin pie! All the baked items looked delicious and I don't believe it's possible to make a bad choice. Recommended if you're ever in the area.

restaurant_name: Pie in the Sky Bakery & Cafe
author: carrie m
text:
Your only real vegan option in wood‚Äôs hole.

We came here while waiting for our marine biological laboratory tour to start. I got the cornbread muffin and the peanut butter chocolate chip cookie.

Both were quite tasty!  I honestly think I may have preferred the cornbread muffin. (The cookie was good, but maybe a little too much at once? It had a squishy factor to it, and it was packed with chocolate chips, so the squish factor was compounded with maybe too many chips and it wasn‚Äôt super cohesive. Easily broke into pieces.  The flavor was great though.)

My husband liked them both equally.

author: G. Hauray
text: We had a fantastic lunch here on the deck overlooking the harbor. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The food was great, and it felt like our own private space. Lovely spot to sit and watch the boats!

author: Brent Christensen
text:
Made reservations the night before while on a sailing charter. Super easy place to get to from the water once you know where it is, a dinghy dock right in front is super helpful.
Dinner was amazing start to finish. Our Waiter was top knotch and the somm was on point.  Great menu that was well executed, and a great wine list that was super fun to explore. We will be back when we come around again.
We had local oysters, Tuna Poke, Halibut Hamachi, beetroot gnocchi, mussels, a super cool carrot dish for 1st and second courses. We then had Char, Sea Bass, Halibut, Scallops.  Each one was spot on. The Scallops were some of the best any of us had every had. The fish dishes were all great with perfectly cooked fish and interesting flavors complementing the fish.

Highly reccommend!

author: Yasmin Ahee
text: My wife and I had our wedding welcome event here, Memorial Day weekend.  Our guest couldn‚Äôt stop talking about how much fun they had. We all thought the staff were friendly with impeccable service. The food and drinks are to die for The vibe is everything one could ask for. It‚Äôs a must dining experience when in MVY!

author: Barnet Sherman
text: A hidden gem in Vineyard Haven. We had early appetizers and their specialty cocktails. Great on both, particularly the cocktails. Combine that with a view of VH Harbor (see pic) and you have a lovely afternoon. We‚Äôre finding time for a dinner. Strong recommendation: go!

author: Jessica French
text: This is a magical place!! The food was delicious! The servers were attentive, warm, and friendly! And the atmosphere is wonderful. The restaurant manager, Phoebe,  couldn‚Äôt have been more pleasant. She is beautiful and was exceptionally welcoming to us as guests! Garde East was a great dining experience and we will be back!

author: Olivera Dzuver
text:
We tried several dishes recommended by our server. He was very nice and attentative. Everything was delicious, tasty and perfectly seasoned. Had couple of drinks also. Lots of options for everyone. They have outside patio also.
Worth trying and will go again.

author: Raveendranath Reddy
text: Don‚Äôt be misled by the limited number of reviews‚Äîit‚Äôs only been three weeks since they opened. The food was excellent! I tried the beetroot kebab for the first time, and it was absolutely delicious. Both the alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks were also impressive.

author: Holly and Kevin
text:
We are so excited to finally have year-round Indian cuisine on the Island! We visited Indigo just a few days after they opened (August 2025), and they did not disappoint. Our favorites on the menu were the Madrasi chicken, the Goan shrimp curry, and the cheese naan. All were bursting with incredible flavor.

We also enjoyed the OG Butter Chicken; the sauce was rich and delicious, though we‚Äôd love to see a bit more protein in the portion to balance the sauce-to-protein ratio. Given that we visited within their first week of opening, we imagine they‚Äôre still fine-tuning some of the details, and it certainly didn‚Äôt take away from how tasty the dish was and we‚Äôd happily order it again.

One area that could improve was the speed of service. From placing our order to receiving the food, and when waiting for the check, the pace was slower than ideal - we waited about ~40 minutes for our dishes. It felt like the team is still getting into their rhythm, which is understandable for a brand-new restaurant.

Overall, Indigo is a fantastic addition to the Edgartown dining scene, and we‚Äôre looking forward to many more flavorful meals here!

author: Ambiemae
text:
This place is wonderful! Food is amazing and service is great! We got take out and it was delicious.
We got butter chicken, chicken korma, garlic naan, cheese naan and bhel puri chaat
All were delicious and well prepared. I hope this places stays open for years to come! Felt like we were eating offisland somewhere, such a great addition to the island.

author: Luz Martinez
text: The food is extremely hot spicy. We asked for mild food, and we could not eat it. When we told the manager that we had ordered mild but couldn't eat it because because it was too hot spicy for us, he took about 30 minutes to let us know that Indian food couldn't be milder. We have eaten in other Indian restaurants. They modify the food to suit palates that can't tolerate hot spices. So we are never eating there again. Hopefully, the vineyard opens an Indian restaurant that can accommodate those of us that like spicy food without having tears coming out of our eyes because of how hot spicy it is.

author: Jack Phillips
text: Go here and ask about the time Stan caught a 20 foot 3000 lb 9 foot diameter great white shark! Excellent. Such great service and fresh fish.

author: Rich Kahn
text: We went here to have take out dinner with a relaxing view of the sunset.  I had the warm lobster roll which did not hold together well, but was quite tasty.

author: Reb G
text: Ordered a +$20 fish sandwich and got a slimy piece of partially grilled fish on a roll. Literally nothing else - no lettuce, tomato, flavor - just slimy undercooked fish. It was probably one of the grossest things I‚Äôve attempted to consume and couldn‚Äôt eat it. I literally have zero idea how this place has good reviews. My husbands lobster roll was average to below average. Would never recommend this place.

author: Nicole Landers
text: Delicious oysters right next to the sea! A nice hike 5mins up the road too. You can walk right on the beach as well. They have daily specials. A favorite of ours, and our friends.

author: R McCaskill
text: Menemsha Beach is an absolute must-visit! Grab a hot, buttery lobster roll from Menemsha Fish Market‚Äîthe best on the island‚Äîand settle in to watch the beautiful sunset. The beach offers breathtaking views, making it the perfect backdrop for a memorable evening. Don‚Äôt miss this iconic experience, it truly captures the essence of Martha‚Äôs Vineyard!

author: Dominik Dujmoviƒá
text: Amazing experience from start to finish. The baked oysters were delicious, the salmon perfectly cooked, and the cr√®me br√ªl√©e outstanding. The staff were attentive and friendly, and the manager made sure everything was perfect. Truly flawless, highly recommend!

author: Sara
text: Dinner was so good I forgot to get a before photo. Came in straight from the ferry and a long day of traveling and this was the perfect spot to stop. The filet was amazing and service at the bar was great even though the bartender was busy and it was pretty full. Will definitely stop back by with my family and get a table before my visit is over!

author: Jasmine Hollins-Gadbois
text: The waitress was unclear from the start about needing to order starters and entrees at the same time. Allegedly the chefs preference. In my opinion they want to have you commit for the full meal and deliver sub par food. They did not have any hot beverages. It was absolutely freezing inside with the ac blasting on a cool day. I requested tea and then asked if i could just have hot water with lemon. Kind of ridiculous that a pot of water cant be boiled. The oysters were the highlight. Mussels puttanesca was salty. The salad could have been done better at home.

author: Kelli Costa
text:
My friends and I went on a girls trip to Martha‚Äôs Vineyard the weekend before Memorial Day and this was one of the restaurants a friend recommended. We walked in and right away absolutely loved the atmosphere! Very modern and chic.

Two of us decided to have a cocktail, and we both loved the Ninegroni. A couple of the girls got salads, and two of us got the burger and fries, which for me was the best meal of the trip! Great service and spectacular food!

author: Brian Martynowicz
text:
Food was excellent. We had the lobster tostadas, the pappardelle, and the clam chowder. All three were hits.

They‚Äôre doing some really interesting things with the ingredients‚Äîcreative, but not over the top. Everything was flavorful, and the pappardelle was perfectly al dente. Chowder was rich without being heavy. Lobster tostadas were a standout.

Couldn‚Äôt recommend it more. Solid spot if you're in the area.

author: Jon Rogers
text: The staff was on top of everything and made the experience amazing from start to finish. The French dip sliders were absolutely perfect, and the mac and cheese was to die for! The Attic salad was fresh, loaded with goat cheese, and full of flavor. I had the American burger and it was cooked perfectly, juicy and delicious. The atmosphere was cozy and had a great old-style charm. Definitely a place I‚Äôd recommend and can‚Äôt wait to go back!

author: Zack Maron
text: Quite possibly the coolest place ever. Right from the beginning here the vibe is incredible, and relaxing. Classy even. The service is attentive and respectful. The menu was outstanding for unique food options, and a perfect speakeasy style drink menu. The paper plane I got was legendary. That food though‚Ä¶. Burger with brisket, red wine glaze, and Brie cheese?? Yes please. Go try this place. It‚Äôll be a new island staple for us.

author: Xavier Bost
text: Our party visited the Attic by recommendation for our friend's birthday celebration. So glad we could get a reservation the day before. The atmosphere was intimate, warm and inviting like a summer cottage. The food and drinks were soooo good. We shared the watermelon salad, muscles and warm bread to dip in the sauce and I personally had the baked chicken with mashed potatoes and saut√©ed summer squash & zucchini. Everything g was seasoned well and super flavorful. The portions were so bug I had leftovers for the next day.  the Our waiter was incredible - friendly, accommodating, attentive and took the best pics of our group with the birthday girl. What shocked me most is how friendly the other patrons were. They asked if they could watch our stuff while we took pics, one senior lady offered to take our when we were waiting on our waiter to come back, and another older man ran after us when we went in another room for our pic to make sure we weren't forgetting our things at the table.

author: Vincent Errichetti (Taste of Massachusetts)
text:
You may not expect to find an out of this world's Burger on Martha's Vineyard, but here it is!
This was my last stop of the day and the video says it all. Excellent, well built over stuffed burger, the tuna Tartare is excellent but the freshness really kicked it up a notch, and the fried cheese curds that a random person sitting next to me demanded that I put in the video were addictive.
The attic  Visit Martha's Vineyard

author: D F
text:
During a recent visit to The Attic Restaurant, I had the chance to explore a variety of items off their menu and I walked away already looking forward to my next visit.
The meal began with a mix of appetizers and mains‚ÄîTuna Tartar, Attic Wings, Beets, Steak Au Poivre, Lobster Corn Fritters , Hot and Cold Lobster Rolls accompanied by drinks. The standouts for me were definitely the drinks, the Hot and Cold Lobster Rolls and the Steak Au Poivre of which all were incredibly flavorful and satisfying. The Attic Wings had just the right amount of kick, the Beets were cooked to perfection, rich and well-seasoned and the Lobster Corn Fritters were packed with flavored and served with a nice size of lump lobster.
