However, I thought the side of mashed potatoes did lacked flavor and texture, and the Tuna Tartar didn‚Äôt quite live up to expectations and wish there had been more avocado to help balance the taste. The rice was not prepared completely. Overall, the good definitely outweighed the bad.
The atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming, making it a great spot to unwind and enjoy good food with friends/family. The laid-back vibe, along with the service of Anthony the bartender (definitely ask for him to make your drinks) and Lobster rolls and Steak Au Poivre , makes The Attic Restaurant a place I‚Äôll definitely be returning to.

author: Kareem Alston-Rosales
text: Excellent, excellent meal, the best we've had in Martha's Vineyard! The risotto was delicious, the brussel sprouts were fantastic. We had the halibut, the salmon, the pasta, all were really great. Really tasty cocktails as well. The service was awesome, the chef is a really cool and the inside has a nice casual vibe. If you come for drinks, check out the nook with the couch seats by the bar!

author: L T
text: Without a doubt ~ one of Martha's Vineyard's BEST experiences! Chef (and his glorious brigade of culinary masters) will WOW you with one-of-a-kind creations. Timothy's cocktails are equally crafted to perfection with the most delightful ingredients & a skillful, considerate composition every damn time. Timothy will provide you with the kind of consistency, courteousness, and divine drinks you dream about...he is indeed a hidden treasure of the island! Jacob and the serving staff each bring a special something, too, and I promise you will want to return to see this extraordinary team, the next new & exciting spectacular menu items, and the latest lovely libations ~ all guaranteed to rock your world!!! After years at the Red Cat, I continue to be blown away. If you are on the fence, take a chance...the quality and attention to every detail will keep you coming back for much, much more. Hopefully, if none of this is enough, a photograph of my filfthy martini with fried chicken + fried tomato combo will help get you in their door ASAP :)

author: James Gibson
text: Outstanding Vibes - A+ staff and hands down the most beautiful food and beverage on Circuit ave. Must have Brussels, and don‚Äôt sleep on the fried chicken. This br√ªl√©ed Gold Bud Peach was sublime iykyk.

author: Chris A
text:
A local recommended this spot and it did not disappoint. Did not have a reservation but got seats at the bar.   Nice open layout to the restaurant.  Spacious bar with a good selection of drinks and spirits.  Kevin the bartender was very attentive in spite of being busy.

Speciality old fashioned and Manhattan for cocktails.  Both were very good.   We ordered a couple of appetizers rather than meals.

Highly recommend the Brussel Sprouts. Great flavor and enough to share.  The Shrimp and Crab cocktail had a good flavor but not stellar.  We were surprised how small the shrimp were especially at $28.  I would not recommend the shrimp.

Overall a great spot and would eat here again.

author: Kathieya Bell
text: The food was immaculate! Really great dishes and drinks. I it‚Äôs not the biggest dining space, but we were comfortable and there for the food. We will be making an annual visit here whenever we‚Äôre on the island.

author: Ron Rogers
text:
Nice place to grab a bite, drink, or both. I also understand they are one of the few restaurants to stay open year round.

We popped in for a late lunch. We ordered the truffle fries 4.5/5, seared cod tacos 3/5, and fish and chips 4.5/5.

The service is good. The atmosphere is modern pub.

author: mary wurthman
text: Many a fresh oyster was gobbled up by me during their happy hour buck a shuck!  We also tried the tuna poke nachos for half of their original price. It was all divine, and the service was impeccable! Our waiter was a blast!

author: Mary Pecock
text:
We were a party of 7. Meg our server was so friendly and knowledgeable, she patiently answered all our questions. Food was absolutely phenomenal, to look at and of course to eat. We ate a variety of different dishes with each being mouth watering. Portion sizes were larg enough that we all had leftovers.
Atmosphere was good however not handicapped accessible in the least. Not only does one have to go up steps to enter the establishment, one has to go up 2 flights of stairs to get to the dining area. It's a pity a physically challenged person might miss out on the delights of the restaurant. I'm handicapped myself and could barely manage so felt it important to mention.

author: Hayden Boettcher
text:
The good: The atmosphere is nice, servers were friendly and attentive, and those at the table who ordered seafood were reasonably happy with their meals.

The bad: I hate to leave a poor review, but the non-seafood options were just awful. The pizza was a cracker (honest to god a 0/10 pizza), the salad was wildly overdressed, and the cheese dip that came with the cauliflower was borderline inedible.

I‚Äôm sure the seafood is a safe bet, but if anyone in your party is looking for non-seafood options I can‚Äôt recommend this place.

author: Matt M
text: Enjoyed the experience very much. Good service and a great atmosphere. I had the calamari and it was perfectly cooked and love the aioli sauce.

author: Kayla Thibodeau
text:
We love the Square Rigger! One of the highlights is being able to see the chef in action‚Äîsuch a unique experience! He was not only incredibly talented but also very friendly and welcoming, which added a personal touch to the evening.

We ordered two pasta dishes, and both were absolutely phenomenal‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. You could tell a lot of care and skill went into every detail. The drinks were just as impressive‚Äîwell-crafted and refreshing, pairing great with our meals.

We‚Äôll definitely be coming back! Highly recommend!

author: Duda Gobbi
text: Had a amazing experience here. We ordered the swordfish and the Salmon special of the day.  Everything was so tasty and the salmon had real mango on it. Drinks were refreshing. Had the Berries margarita and smoked old fashioned. Will be coming back for sure.

author: Dr. GEORGE
text:
The food was awesome! Great flavors and wonderful portions! My wife had the salmon, I had the paella. Both were absolutely delicious, and the staff was extremely pleasant and fun to be with! We are VINEYARDERS and found our new go to restaurant!

My wife and I went back one week later and were not disappointed!! Consistent excellence!!! Natalia, our waitress, was super attentive. Kamila made awesome drinks and introduced us to a delicious dessert ( a peach mousse, made from the chef's mom's recipe), and the chef, Everton, made an awesome paella for us both. The staff are warm, personable, and fun to be with.Very homey and family oriented with a Brazilian flare. The calamari appetizer was both delicious and plentiful, no skimping on the portion or the flavor!!!! This place is an Edgartown gem, and a much improved upgrade over the previous Square Rigger. We are so happy with our new place to enjoy a great meal, nice atmosphere, and fine people.

author: Linda Heasley
text: Food was awesome as well as service! Don‚Äôt skip the buffet like we did , had a sample of steak and it‚Äôs out of this world!

author: Marnely Murray
text: Square Rigger has been a long standing standing for so many families on MV! The new ownership has shown care into the new dishes and has kept the traditional ones as well! Great drinks and mocktails too, and a fun enviroment !

author: Ian Wallace
text: Thai tea drink has a tasty topping but it's like drinking lime juice. Burger was medium but came well done as per uge with golf club burgers. Not bad but I don't think it's actually dry age. Key lime has a molasses crust that's more intense than the filling. Good date spot but I'd guess 250$ for a couple. This was 60$+ I left 20.

author: Todays Present
text: We loved this restaurant. The power salad with salmon was perfect. Very light but enough sustenance to get through the day. Our waiter, Forest, was not very friendly and he didn't remove the items requested from the burger nor did he order the correct side. But the other staff we encountered were very nice and very helpful. They had great customer service. The salmon and cod sandwich (the day's special) was amazing! The bathroom was nice and clean. The location was overall beautiful. We would absolutely return again.

author: Reginald Blackwell
text:
We were hesitant walking into this place and it was intimidating that it was inside a golf course. The staff was welcoming and pleasant from the hostess to the waiters who attended to us.

The food selection was great with a variety of options and very reasonably priced. Whether your eating in the dining room or outside your have views of the green golf course.

Also we did make reservations online the night before for our trip.

author: alison harris
text: We enjoyed a delicious lunch here. The staff are positively as wonderful as the food. We had a salad - grain bowl, burger and the fresh made chips. All cooked superbly and such a gorgeous view. Our lunch here cost little more than a horrible breakfast we had elsewhere. It's not cost - prohibitive. Try it. Can't compliment them enough. Again, truly amazing service.

author: Kitty G
text: Lovely outdoor space with a very nice menu and a view overlooking the golf course and gardens. My Cobb salad had disappointing chunks of romaine lettuce but otherwise was fine. The patio was surprisingly noisy, however. Very good service.

restaurant_name: Aquila at the Y Cafe - Smoothies & Acai
author: Rachel Araujo
text: An awesome experience!! First of all, this place is so easy to access! Lots of good parking for this inviting little cafe in the public area of the beautiful YMCA building!! We tried the egg sandwich and an acai bowl! So Delicious! Great portions and the staff was so welcoming and attentive! We also had their cold brew and a latte‚Ä¶ delicious island roasted blend! What a treat! Definitely worth checking this place out!! I didn‚Äôt even know the Y allowed folks into the building to their cafe without being a member, but it was easy peasy and so welcoming! Thanks Aquila! We will be back for sure!!

restaurant_name: Aquila at the Y Cafe - Smoothies & Acai
author: Marnely Murray
text: If you find yourself needing a pick me up, head to Aquila at the YMCA for all the perfect treats and snacks! Coffee is fab, the a√ßa√≠ bowls are perfection, and the smoothies just the perfect hit of protein you need! 100% recommended!

restaurant_name: Aquila at the Y Cafe - Smoothies & Acai
author: Shored Up Digital
text:
As a team, we love hitting Aquila at the Y after workouts. The espresso drinks are consistently excellent: smooth and balance! and when we need something more substantial, the chocolate protein shake is our go-to: cold, rich, and genuinely satisfying without feeling heavy. Service is quick and friendly, the space is bright and clean, and it‚Äôs easy to grab-and-go between meetings.

Reliable quality, fair prices, and friendly staff, Aquila at the Y is our post-workout fuel-up spot!

restaurant_name: Aquila at the Y Cafe - Smoothies & Acai
author: Brett Nevin
text: Exceptional service with excellent coffee and the best smoothies on my Vineyard. This is a true gem located in the YMCA gym that you must go check out.

restaurant_name: Aquila at the Y Cafe - Smoothies & Acai
author: Katherine O'Brien
text: As a personal trainer at the YMCA, Aquila is my go-to spot. The breakfast bowls are fresh and filling, the smoothies are perfect post-workout, and the coffee never disappoints. The vibe is great, and the staff is always friendly. I highly recommend checking them out!

author: Joseph Raczynski
text:
I like the concept of this place, relaxed, easy, airy, yet with a bent towards sophistication, but there were several misses. First the hits... The mussels were very well done. The sauce was deep, rich and well executed. The big boxy bread was a treat - and the butter a perfect herb infused compliment.

The fish and chips, a staple, had an excellent batter, but for nearly $50, was a bit of a eye watering price for two pieces of fried fish on a bed of fries. The fish that night, in an iridescent green broth, looked divine, but it was thin and rather bland. I heard the duck was well done, but didn't taste it.

In general, if you come here, the service will be great, the prices astronomical, and the food overall solid to very good, the prices knock this down to a B overall.

author: Ed Holden
text: A fancy, expensive restaurant with genuinely good food. I had the pasta with cream sauce, and the portion was much more generous than I expected. A couple people with me raved about the fish. Dessert was a shared creme brulee, which was a little toasty in flavor. Overall, a good meal. Reservations are a must in the summer. Be warned: it's BYOB, with a corking fee for wine bottles.

author: Maggie J
text:
Came on a Monday night for a 5:30pm reservation with 3 girlfriends. We came on the early side because we wanted to watch the sunset on the beach after dinner. The dining room was pretty sparsely populated when we arrived but both the main dining room and the outdoor patio had filled up by the time we left at 6:45.

Since it‚Äôs BYOB, we brought a bottle of wine and a bottle of batched Negronis which our waitress quickly brought out glasses for and served. For dinner we started with the bread, special cheese starter and summer squash. I thought that the squash was really exceptional. For my main course I ordered the half chicken. It came with a side salad and was crispy, juicy and delicious. Two of my girlfriends got the chicken pot pie and said it was one of the best they ever had. The Buffalo Brussels were also on point.

The food here felt like having a great home cooked meal. Looking forward to coming back!

author: Robert Jacoby
text:
Had a great experience here. The atmosphere was really casual, but nice; the service was 5 stars; the menu was really inventive. Four stars overall because, even though the food was very unique, it didn‚Äôt deliver as much flavor as I would have liked. The pasta dish pictured here was good, but not great; the scallops were good, but again, not a great overall dish (although they were cooked nicely).

The place is BYOB‚Äî$14 corking fee for a bottle of wine‚Äîwhich I think is very reasonable. Overall, prices are fair.

I‚Äôd go back to try some other things, but for now, I‚Äôm fairly impressed!

author: Alan Karp
text:
Our family had an absolutely amazing experience and a wonderful first meal out on Island last week.

We were eager to goto some new restauraunts and we will most definetly be back!

They are BYOB and do a fantastic job at it!!! We brought bourbon and wine to drink while dining.

We tried the following:

Apps:

- Calamari App
- Onion rings
- Sourdough w/ scape butter (to die for)

Entrees:

- Vegetarian curry * 3 people
- Fish and Chips
- Tuna entree over green beans (SO FRESH)
- Wagyu steak and lobster Mac n cheesy

All were cooked to perfection. The atmosphere was on point and we had no complaints at all.

Will be back again. 10/10 would reccomend to a friend!

author: Samantha Webster
text: I ordered the cake cake sandwich and it was really really good. Lump crab, lightly fried to perfection! Thank you!!

author: Swetha Mohanakrishnan
text: We were visiting Martha‚Äôs Vineyard and it was off season. Only a few restaurants were open. Went to town bar and grill and had good food with great service! We ordered roasted brussel sprouts which were yum, tagaroshi fries which stole the show, cheese burger, fish and chips and mozzarella sticks.

author: Scott Mackenzie
text:
The bar staff here here are exceptional.
If I was a restaurant or bar owner, there is no one I would like more than these people.
Friendly, helpful, know your name, work hard and reliable. I came twice and these were the same people who served me.
Knew my drinks, always checked up on me and kept the place running. Kudos to the two of them.

author: Ray
text:
While biking on the island, we picked this place as it's along the bike trail and the price review is not about $50 per person.
I was surprised to see they have sushi counter and menu, but we didn't bother.
The portions were good for the island price. Presentations were nicely done as well.
I had the shrimp scampi. Fresh and plump shrimp. Freshly made fettuccine. It could use a pinch of extra salt to bring out the flavor which I did.
My wife had the pork chop. Very nicely done, tender and juicy. Great flavor.
Kids shared popcorn chicken and chicken tacos. Both very flavorful. The taco had salsa with bacon bits, and that was a nice touch.

author: Dumbfat
text: Came here on a work trip. It was during trivia night so the restaurant was abuzz with people, good music and fun times. Food was very good and the service was quick! I got the Surf and Turf which came with steak tips over mashed potatoes and fried scallops. Delicious!

author: Andrue Carr
text:
Mother's day brunch. We usually dine at Lola's each year. They went out of business. We like the buffet style for brunch. I saw mention of Town having that.
Called for a reservation.  Mike guided me to that.
Easy parking. Walked in the door. Great decorations. Clean and stylish. They even have a pancake machine.
The buffet was a bit small but had more than enough to fill our plates. Our table was a bit wobbly.
The service was great. Its new. Room for improvement.  I look forward to our next visit.

author: Jess Freeds
text:
Nancy‚Äôs was everything. From the second we sat down, we knew we were in for something special. Let‚Äôs start with the fries ‚Äî so crispy, so golden, so delectable they honestly might‚Äôve changed our lives. Easily the star of the table and not just an afterthought side.

The service? Incredible. Attentive and kind without ever hovering ‚Äî they struck the perfect balance between friendly and chill. Even the water was a highlight: icy, crisp, and self-serve (which we loved).

We ordered a lot (the portions were huge) but were pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to box things up to bring home ‚Äî it was all so filling in the best way. The Greek salad was fresh, flavorful, and everything you want from a salad. And the buffalo chicken wrap? Absolutely hit the spot ‚Äî packed with flavor and paired with amazing sides.

The atmosphere was its own kind of magic ‚Äî bustly, coastal, and the perfect blend of casual and classy. The place had such a welcoming, cultural vibe ‚Äî families, friends, reunions, locals, and tourists all mixed in together. The menu had so many diverse options, it felt like everyone could find something they loved.

All in all? Nancy‚Äôs nailed it. The food, the vibe, the service ‚Äî everything. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better meal or a better place to spend our evening.
Five out of five. Would go again in a heartbeat.

author: Susan Macbeth
text: Had high hopes for Nancy's after reading blogs and reviews. My lobster which was pink inside, potatoes, and corn were not up to par despite the pictures, along with the fried belly clams. The Clam chowder however was tasty.

author: Tish Mac
text: I went for the chowder fries (appetizer)! Best I ever had!! Definitely a must try, underrated on reviews, that‚Äôs for sure. Came out hot and had so much flavor created a party in my mouth üòâ

author: Expert Wildlife Removal
text: We had high expectations for Nancy‚Äôs, given its iconic location in Oak Bluffs and the buzz around it ‚Äî but unfortunately, the experience missed the mark. We waited over 30 minutes without being greeted by a server, and our drinks took longer to arrive than our sushi roll. The food itself was okay, but the service really soured the night. Hoping it was just an off evening, but sadly, it was a letdown for us.

author: Sharanya Sarkar
text: Highly recommend. The wait time suggested to us during peak summer weekend hours was very accurate. We enjoyed our lunch with the great water views. I took the dad bod cocktail and absolutely loved it (w/ bourbon, pineapple, and orange). Also, their Nancy roll was amazing. It was juiciest sushi I've ever had. I also loved their fish and chips (freshest fish I've had in a while). Great service by Allison as well! Would come back when I'm here again! üíú

author: Murat Gungor
text: The best dish is the most ordinary one. Bolognese pasta is tasty, filling and a treat for the eyes. The ambiance is a reason in and of itself to visit this establishment. Vault turned into wine cave, safe door become a communal table and decorations reminiscent of the bank that once stood there give this restaurant a quirky museum touch. The food and cocktails are pricy which leaves you with the expectation for an amazing culinary journey. Cassoulet is delicious but overwhelming in size. Best to be mindful of all the mains being oversized when ordering. It's a nice treat when on the Vineyard.

author: N Sockwell
text:
Drinks: The Stone Bank (bourbon & vermouth) and Cabernet. Entrees: Veal Saltimbocca with fingerling potatoes and Prime Brandt Steak with fries for dinner.  I thought the veal was ok but I have had better.  Hubby had the steak medium but said he also has had better. The restaurant was an old converted bank, the atmosphere was very relaxing.  The service was good however the server neglected to tell us about a misprint on the menu until we ordered the item. Also the server didn‚Äôt mention the menu additions until we asked. Live piano music. We sat in the dining area of the bar.  Reservations accepted.
For the cost, I would not recommend. Even on MV I thought it was way overpriced. ü´©

author: L M
text:
The decor is lovely. The chef hit it out of the park on flavors, Five Stars. Wines by the glass were terrific. The mezze appetizer could not have been better. But that‚Äôs where the good news ended. A restaurant that is always changing its menu runs a risk, the same way that specials at a restaurant are not always as good as the tried and true. It must be difficult for the kitchen at The Ocean Club with all their changing up.
Point in fact, the lasagna bolognese was so dry it may have been the worst thing I have ever ordered. Tasted great flavor wise and the filling would have been nice on pasta (think meaty bolognese that runs on the dry side, clinging to rigatoni), but honestly I could not cut it thin enough to eat and the sparse amount of yummy sauce on the plate that I dipped it in soon ran out. The half duck that (per our server)  took days to prepare had a sauce with a delectable flavor, but the meat was oddly grey and mushy. Maybe cooked too long via sous vide or other method?
I hope they decide to land on a few tried and true menu items, and if they want to get creative, vary the sauce seasonings or sub out an ingredient here and there. Not major shifting like they are doing. Or better yet, leave a core set of selections alone and don‚Äôt mess with perfection.

author: Marc Shapiro
text: Wonderful dining experience on multiple occasions. Food is very creative and flavorful.    Menu changes frequently,  so always something new to try.   Great to have a historic island site repurposed so well.

author: Virginia Pribanic
text: Had a wonderful dinner with 2 friends this evening at Ocean Club in Vineyard Haven.  Our incredible waitress was Vicky.  She guided us through the menu and made wonderful ,recommendations for every course, including wines.  The restaurant is absolutely beautiful.  I had the Bolognese, the best Bolognese I've ever had. We shared several appetizers.  This is simply a perfect restaurant, and manager Travis is doing a great job keeping everything moving so smoothly, which is truly remarkable for the second week of operation.  Thank you to everyone at Ocean Club, we will be back!

author: Brian Skidmore
text: Been coming to Espresso Love on MV for years. Always a great experience and the folks work hard and have a good time. Especially in the very busy summer. I‚Äôm heading out of EL right now, looking forward to my next visit.

author: Jackie Levine
text:
We absolutely loved Espresso Love during our trip to Martha‚Äôs Vineyard! We ended up coming here almost every day of our 6-day stay. We were staying in Edgartown and made it a morning ritual to walk over for a fresh scone (they rotate flavors daily!) and an iced tea and matcha.

The online ordering option was super convenient, especially on busy mornings when the line was long. There‚Äôs also a great back patio with plenty of seating ‚Äî perfect for enjoying breakfast outside. Can‚Äôt wait to come back next time we‚Äôre on the island!

author: Meredith Salvo
text:
I ordered the Vienna Latte with half and half. It‚Äôs definitely one of the top ten, if not the best, coffee drink that I‚Äôve ever had in my life.
Ivan made it. Thank you, Ivan. My daughter ordered a smoothie. I feel the same way about her smoothie. Fresh, tangy bursting with flavor subtly sweet.

author: Evangeline Earl
text: Super cute cafe with big outdoor patio, good cappuccino, delish Asiago bagel/sausage/cream cheese, and super friendly customer service. Felt so welcomed! Go here if in Edgartown!

author: Tuguldur TJ
text: I hope Vika and everyone are doing wonderfully. I truly love this place ‚Äî the last time I visited was in 2018, but it still feels like yesterday. I still miss the delicious cookies, sandwiches, and coffee! I hope to come back soon with my family. Wishing you all the very best and sending lots of warm memories your way.

author: Morgan Fykes
text: The Makers opened in 2025 and somehow we missed it last summer so we went in December after a friend recommended it.  The space is cute and intimate and decorated so cute.  Our meal was good, I especially loved the sauce and desert.  Excited to have a new restaurant on island.  I will definitely be back again! We were able to get a table for 4 walking in and the host was so kind and accommodating.  Thanks for a great visit!

author: Erika Bilzerian
text:
I had such a great time dining here. I started with the Paloma, which came with a cinnamon sugar rim‚Äîhands down the best Paloma I‚Äôve ever had in my entire life. For food, I ordered the Angus beef meatballs and they were incredibly flavorful. We also had to try the Bucatini pasta, which was so delicious and perfectly cooked.

My husband ordered the Faroe Island salmon and loved it‚Äîsuper fresh and beautifully prepared. The service was excellent from start to finish, and we were even greeted by the cook, which was such a nice touch.

Highly recommend The Maker to anyone visiting Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. We will definitely be back!

author: Simply K2 Marketing
text:
The Maker MV is Martha's Vineyard's newest GEM and it's SO worth stopping in. I may have, no I DID, have the best meal I've had in years on the Island at the Maker MV and we couldn't have been treated better.

I have a garlic allergy and not only was the restaurant responsive to my questions ahead of time (as the smell is a factor too), when I arrived they shared a list of dishes I COULD enjoy with my family - and some, where I'd have to ask for a substitution on an ingredient. Talk about 10/10 service!

We had a freshly made starter - a ficaccia bread 'starter" with olive oil  - while it looked amazing, they did forewarn me that it had garlic so I had to pass. My family loved it.

For dinner, I ordered the Lumache and was in lemon heaven. This freshly made pasta dish did not disappoint. The sauce was a perfect balance, not overwelming or overly sauced, and I loved the nutty chunch of the toasted pangrattato. My family ordered the new to the menu that night, Halibut, and a menu staple, Bucatiti.  All were perfection and not a scrap left on the dish as you can see.  I'm still dreaming about the Lumache!

For dessert I finally got the GBB show dessert of my dreams a Strawberry Pavlova - I swear there was a hint of coconut and maybe mango? It was a sweet crunchy blissful ending to a perfect night.

Note they don't yet have their liquor license so there was BYOB but we didn't miss a thing with soda, water and other beverages. They even have my favorite soda Something & Nothing's Rose & Hibiscus.

Truly Sheenagh and Chef Carlos have nailed it and this is a spot YOU MUST STOP IN this summer - or fall or winter. I hear the plan is to stay open all-year long too! I can't wait to go back. Just remember to call ahead for reservations! They do sell out.

THANK YOU for taking such good care of me and advising what I could order - no other resturant has done that so well. Kudos!

author: Brian Holland
text: My wife and I had a wonderful dinner at The Maker Restaurant. We arrived 15 minutes after they opened at 5pm. We brought a bottle of wine with us. The staff quickly brought us glasses and offered us a chiller. We started with the brussels sprouts as an appetizer, which were perfectly crisp and full of flavor. For the main course, we both had the tagliolini, and it was excellent fresh, pasta with a rich, well-balanced sauce. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the service was just right. We were dining outside on the picnic tables since we had our dog with us. Didn't dine inside, but it looked quant and cozy. We'll definitely be back!

author: Rose Walsh
text: Sheenagh and Chef Carlos knocked it out of the park!  We ordered from their catering menu and it was perfect. The food was delicious, crab cakes, half roasted chicken, steak, fettuccine, the shawarma carrots,roasted potatoes, Caesar Salad and the fall vegetables salad oh and homemade focaccia!!!  With Tiramisu for desert. It was all perfectly packed up, we opted for pickup and it was ready on time all ready to go with detailed instructions. Their communication was immediate and they were so helpful in planning and suggestions, we could not have pulled it off with out them. We are so grateful and can not recommend their services enough. A true 10 out of 10!!

author: Maggie J
text:
We had dinner at Homeport with a large group of 10 people on a Thursday night. They seated us around 5 minutes after we checked in and though we placed drink orders right away they did take a fair amount of time to come out.

The restaurant was fairly crowded and our waitress seemed a bit overwhelmed. Our oysters didn‚Äôt come out for half an hour, non-raw apps 45 minutes and our main courses didn‚Äôt hit the table for almost 90 minutes.

The oysters were fresh and we really enjoyed the summer succotash, stuffed quahogs and cornbread. For my main I had the Miso Tofu which was ok. It could have been spicier and the inclusion of corn ribs hiding in the curry felt like a mistake because I thought I had somehow found a bone in my curry. My husband liked the scallops he ordered but I had friends that didn‚Äôt love the linguine and salmon. Rave reviews for the lobster dinner though.

Overall it was a pretty uneven meal but the view and location are dynamite.

author: Deirdre Ginley
text:
What an absolute treat! Couldn‚Äôt have asked for better weather with that deck view.

Our server, Bella was attentive, gracious, and conversational which added to the experience. The food was phenomenal.
Each menu course offered great options. I had a hard time choosing but the server gave excellent feedback and guidance.

I wish I had taken more photos of the food but we were so immersed in an all around enjoyable dining experience. Capturing it digitally was an after thought.
As a table, we shared a shrimp cocktail and cornbread. The shrimp was big and tasted so fresh. The cornbread was perfect and gave me a teaser to the stuffing in the quahog I ordered. ü§§

‚Ä¢Our first courses included a beautifully balanced watermelon salad and the buttery and savory flavors in the stuffed quahog. ü§åüèΩ
‚Ä¢Second courses included the steak, scallops, swordfish and fried fluke. All 5‚≠êÔ∏è dishes. I was lucky to taste test the others.
Scallops were tender and perfectly cooked, the swordfish was the best I‚Äôve ever tasted, the steak was excellent if you‚Äôre not feeling seafood and I was really surprised by my entree, the fried fluke. Their spin on fish and chips‚Ä¶the onion rings were buttery crisp delicious and the fish had a different breading that was light, filling but not heavy and the Coleslaw was tasty.
It‚Äôs a dry town. BYOB is a nice option. They put our bottle on ice and gave use glassware.
‚Ä¢Dessert selected was key lime pie, blueberry cobbler served in a cute mason jar, and they were out of the strawberry rhubarb pie but they did have a peach pie option served with ice cream

I highly recommend.
We got a little dressy celebrating a birthday but it‚Äôs casual dining. Indoors and out on the deck. Oyster bar outside as well. Great atmosphere and great music gave a light and fun vibe. I‚Äôd love to return.

author: Luisa Andrade
text:
We had an amazing meal at The Homeport , MV. Max was our server, and he was incredibly knowledgeable and attentive, especially when it came to my husband‚Äôs food allergies. We were even given a red allergy alert card to place at his seat‚Äîsuch a thoughtful and reassuring touch.

A huge thank you to the staff, the chef, and the entire team for making our dining experience so seamless and enjoyable.

As a busy mom of three, I hadn‚Äôt made a reservation, but we were still able to get a table even though we were coming from 30 minutes away. The host was kind, welcoming, and accommodating. I‚Äôm so glad we made the trip‚Äîwhat a wonderful experience from start to finish!

author: Jennifer Isaza
text: We had such a great experience here! Our waitress, Roger, was very friendly and helpful. I got the feta and watermelon salad, cornbread, and clam chowder. The chowder broth was amazing and there were large amounts of meat. The watermelon salad was super refreshing. My coworker got the scallops and he said they were some of his favorites he‚Äôs ever had!

author: tess
text: pretty expensive but hear me out‚Ä¶ i had the most incredible pasta dish here i think i have ever had and that shocked me. seriously, for a seafood hotspot i was SHOCKED at how good the pasta was! like, it was INSANELY GOOD. garlic, spinach, tomato, butter, and chili flakes. my goodness. i haven‚Äôt been able to stop thinking about it since!

author: Charlie Matthews
text: Huge portions, great views, very cool vibe inside. It‚Äôs an iconic brand. The food was amazing as well. We had breakfast. Possibly the best pancakes I‚Äôve ever had. If not, top two. Huge portions for the price. Great flavors too! Service was excellent. Go early!!!! We were there on off season and was packed after 8am. Not a lot of parking either. Must be a mad house in the busy season.

author: Sarah Ryherd
text:
Tried to stop in around noon and were told they were only serving a ‚Äúmezze‚Äù menu and lunch started at 12:30 which was confusingly communicated by the hostess and in an unfriendly way. Not to worry though We grabbed some snacks, coffee, and shopped a bit at all the other Black Dog spots until we were able to be seated at 12:30 with a bunch of other families who were all also waiting to eat. Atmosphere inside is great and you can‚Äôt beat the nostalgia factor. Crab spinach and artichoke dip was incredibly good. The lobster rolls were the best we‚Äôve had yet in the Cape Cod area (although the coleslaw left something to be desired). Caesar salad was pretty standard and the crab cakes were just ok. The sauce and corn was good but the crab cakes were too thin and too fried for my taste. The presentation also could use some work.

Other than the service not being the greatest and the unkind hostess, we had a lovely time with beautiful views and tasty food!

author: Samantha Hynes
text: Soup looked delicious and the calamari was great. Loved the fried peppers mixed through it. The fish & chips were okay. Our server was amazing and you can‚Äôt beat eating basically on the water.

author: Vicky Pirozzoli
text:
I brought my family here for lunch for nostalgia as they‚Äôd never been & have heard me speak of the Black Dog for many years. Unfortunately it was during the 1st heat wave of the year. Hoping to catch some relief from the heat when we went inside, we were very disappointed to find they had all the windows open and no air conditioning on. I was literally sweating from head to toe. No breeze today. Not even a fan for some relief for those sitting by the opened windows.
The waitress was very polite and professional. Her speed was appreciated. We ordered the Cobb Salad with Grilled Chicken, the Shrimp Fra Diavolo, and they special-made a Grilled Cheese sandwich. The food was served in small portion size. The shrimp pasta was a bit spicy for my hubby, but he did eat the whole thing. I would have liked more greens on my plate but it was delicious. My daughter thought the Grilled cheese and sides were delicious. We found we were still hungry only a couple hours afterwards. I believe they‚Äôre overpriced for what we received; mainly paying for the brand rather than the food. We probably won‚Äôt be returning and really don‚Äôt recommend if you‚Äôre really hungry.

author: Audrie V
text: We had a great meal here. Food was excellent, better than expected and the service was good too. Bit pricey but that was expected.

author: Susan Macbeth
text: This may be heaven for seafood lovers! It was for us! The service was friendly, fun, and helpful. The selection of fresh seafood that you can order to pick up,  or lovingly prepare for you there and eat outside overlooking the fishing boats was exceptional! The whole lobsters and butter and fresh oysters were over the top fresh and delicious! No words! Love this place!

author: Meera Bhan
text: Best lobster roll we had on the island this trip. Fresh. Good cuts of meat. Butter on the side to add to taste. No formal seating but benches by the water where you can eat while enjoying water view.

author: Nancie Balun
text: Nothing better than ordering the lobster meal! It comes as a takeout and includes a lot of melted butter for dipping your lobster, creamy coleslaw, choice of two different soups, and stuffed clam! No worries, hand sanitizers included or go to the bathrooms nearby! If weather permits, sit outside to eat and then wait for the sunset!! Amazing!!! One of the best things to experience on the island!!!!

author: Ernie Glickman
text:
Fresh seafood and a cafe
Reasonably priced dishes.
Stuffed clams were great.
Benches on the Harbour for beautiful viewing.

author: Rosemary Smith Hoel
text: Seriously this counter service warm lobster roll while sitting on wood crates overlooking the dock was one of the best meals we had on this vacation.  No frills just great food and a small coastal town hallmark movie setting.   My take is the warm better than cold but both delicious.  Eat the warm there drench it in butter and take the cold to go.  Skip the Mac and cheese and get a second roll!   The steamed mussels looked and smelled great but we were stuffed.

author: Joe Joe Giannetti
text: Best breakfast sandwiches around! & the fresh donuts are the highlight of my visits!

author: Laura
text: Their coffee is amazing and the staff are super polite, kind and lovely. I recommend it with my eyes closed!

author: Joe Frawley
text:
They ONLY accept cash and the donuts look like they were bought at a super market. Strawberry frosted tastes like Pepto-Bismol .The coffee is ok if you are in desperate need for one.

No place to sit and parking can be hectic.

The only reason this place does well is that there isn‚Äôt much of a donut and coffee shop in the area.

author: Anna
text: Visiting Martha‚Äôs Vineyard for the first time and ran across this shop on my bike ride. I don‚Äôt normally carry cash on me and I didn‚Äôt know the shop was cash only. The young man behind the counter was so nice and offered me a coffee since I only had a card on me. That is great customer service and that is why I will be back again. This time with cash though üòÅ

author: Kevin Cunningham
text: Unfortunately, since they are the only donut show in town, they have a successful business. This is in spite of the fact they ONLY accept cash and the women that work there are extremely unfriendly and rude. I have never been to a donut shop where the employee rolls their eyes when you take a moment to decide which flavor donuts you want. Carla (I think that's her name) is crass and just plain mean...as are the others that work there for the most part. Donuts are fine but anticipate your coffee order to  be wrong because they don't care and don't listen.

author: Lis Bluford
text: One of the best year-round lunch options on the island! Affordable, quick, conveniently located, filling, creative flavors. The brisket sandwich was a 10/10, and I will be back again to order it!

author: Rick Hamilton
text: The rosemary French fries are wonderful.

author: Katherine Vigeant
text: Friendly staff and excellent food. My husband had the Italian and I had the gobbler. The gobbler is delicious.. turkey breast, homemade stuffing,cranberry sauce,mayo on whole wheat. It's absolutely delicious. The iced cinnamon latte is really good. I definitely recommend for anyone staying on the island to visit them ü•∞. My husband said the Italian was excellent!

author: A. M.
text: We had turkey sandwich and Baja Fish Tacos. Not cheap but they were delicious.  The menu board didn't have price for the fish tacos, but the fish tacos (2 in the order), the turkey sandwich ($14.95) and an iced tea came to $40.

author: Calla Di Pietro
text: We ordered the Chapman (chicken salad) and the Tuna Melt...devoured them in the car and then called back to sing their praises! The Chapman sandwich is genius- the sourdough and pickled relish is awesome with the homemade chicken salad. And the tuna melt...it‚Äôs beyond description!

author: Patrick Ferguson
text: Lobster roll was not worth $21.99, the portion  of lobster didn‚Äôt warrant the price. The lady that took our order and served the food wasn‚Äôt very friendly, seemed annoyed by our presence. Food did taste good though!

author: Jim Connolly
text:
Hands down the best breakfast sandwich on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard, if not anywhere.

Egg Menemsha Loaded. You can‚Äôt go wrong!

Friendly people behind the counter too!

author: Bradley Barrett
text: Bought a small Brazilian pizza, a gluten free pizza, and Philly wrap‚Ä¶ as a tourist from England, ive never seen so many toppings on my pizza, I couldn‚Äôt even finish it! Would highly recommend!!!!

author: Chris Cramton
text:
Convenient parking, friendly service, pizza slices are OK but a little greasy.
(only have tried their pizza, not other selections).

author: Brad Nielander
text: Great dive pizza place. Has wonderful, homemade pizza. Probably one of the best on the island. Can also get pizza by the slice.

author: Jamy Lazarick
text: I ordered a meatball grinder.. got home unwrapped it and I was highly disappointed.. someone took 1 meatball sliced it 1/8 inch thick slices.. maybe 5 slices on the entire grinder.. meatball grinders have full meatball s.. not 1 sliced like a tomato.. very disappointed..

author: Ms. Teacher
text: This place has changed so much. Used to be a great stop en route to the beach. The staff doesn't answer the phone, which makes no sense. Hire someone to take orders! The baffling part is when you go in they see to not be busy in the height of summer for a reason... too much has changed in a negative direction... Disappointing, underwhelming salads and lukewarm food. Theirs pizzas were the biggest (soggy) letdown of all- and we only ordered cheese so it wasn't the toppings fault. Also really overpriced.

author: Tisha Burgess
text:
Fresh, Fun, and Delicious!

We stopped by Backdoor Donuts one morning to try them fresh, and it was absolutely worth it. We ordered a dozen donuts to get a good variety, plus added two apple fritters and a danish to round things out. Every bite was tasty, soft, and flavorful, but the apple fritters really stood out‚Äîwarm, perfectly spiced, and generously portioned.

It was such a fun and memorable experience, and you can really tell these are made fresh with care. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a sweet morning treat or just want to experience a Martha‚Äôs Vineyard staple, this is a spot not to miss. We‚Äôll definitely be back for more fritters and donuts next time!

author: Jon Rogers
text: Yeah, I‚Äôm fritters were awesome. Big chunks of apple and the glaze was outstanding. We also got the cinnamon donuts which were just like com Back in New Jersey which were soft get crispy on the outside. Absolutely delicious highly highly highly recommended.

author: Miss Wells
text:
Walked here for a late night donut craving. Luckily the line was short but they were out several of the most popular flavors, although they still had apple fritters.

This spot is literally operated out of the back door of the business, inside of the parking lot. It's nothing fancy but it's definitely a cool vibe and a novel idea. Flavors we tried: Honey dipped, cinnamon, buttermilk and the infamous apple fritter. The honey dipped tasted like a regular glazed donut - nothing unique. The cinnamon was good, and so was the buttermilk. The apple fritter received good reviews. I plan to return to try other flavors. Overall everything was good and I recommend this place.

author: Cindy Kaye
text: I am 60 years old and I have had a lot of apple fritters in my life(it's my favorite donut) but THIS...THIS WAS ABSOLUTELY EPIC! On a level all by itself. If I had a magic wand, I couldn't make an apple fritter better than this! I am not exaggerating, one of the best things I have ever eaten. Good thing I live in Oklahoma or I would gain 50 lbs eating this regularly, cause oh, I would!

author: S.A.M.
text:
Hot, huge, fresh baked apple filled fritters are # 1!
Absolutely the best we‚Äôve had. I wish Back Door Donuts was in Florida!
The photo shows the bottom side of the fritter. It was larger than our hand.

author: Jessie D
text: My favorite cape cod restaurant! The BEST margaritas. Their tacos, queso, guac are unmatched. This is the place to go with friends or family, such a fun atmosphere and consistently good food! Only complaint is they always have an amazing yearly rotation of vegetarian options but only offer one at a time. It would be nice for a second option (please bring back the buffalo cauliflower asap!) or special but regardless I will be back because it is the best

author: Glaucia Afonso
text:
We had a great experience! We went as a family and were very well taken care of. The food was well-seasoned, light, and authentically Mexican. Prices are reasonable, averaging between $20 to $30 per person per dish.

The only downside was being seated near the restroom. It seems there‚Äôs only one, and the door opens directly into the dining area, which felt a bit inconvenient. The layout could definitely benefit from better architectural planning.

Other than that, our server Rachel was wonderful and made the experience very pleasant.

author: Tif S
text: Tortilla chips are excellent, chicken tacos were good and filling, burrito with veggies was good, kids Mac n cheese was apparently ok. Drinks were amazing, particularly the spicy guava and strawberry margaritas. Cute atmosphere and lovely service!

author: Anushka Mankunath
text: Everything we had was delicious! We came late around 9pm for dinner but it was still high energy and great vibes. I ordered the chicken quesadilla with a side of rice and loved it. The quesadilla was delicious and the rice was amazing and so flavorful. For drinks I had their Moscow mule which was good and made quickly. Overall it was a fun meal!

author: Warner Boss
text: Food was good . Service was good. We ordered queso with our drinks but everything came at once, including our tacos. Lively place . It was a bit loud , hard to have a conversation.  Overall a good place to eat. Just wasn't great.

author: Shored Up Digital
text:
Aalia‚Äôs in OB is our go-to coffee spot in OB, full stop. Their cortados are dialed in; smooth, strong, zero bitterness! And the  cardamom syrup is so, so good in it. Breakfast hits the sweet spot too: fresh, flavorful, and actually filling without being a brick. YOU NEED to try the hashbrowns.

It‚Äôs also prime for people-watching on a slow morning or posting up with the laptop when you need to get stuff done, just‚Ä¶ maybe not both at the same time. Friendly crew, (Oscar is a star) and a vibe that feels like Oak Bluffs in a cup. If you‚Äôre coffee-picky, this is your place! I live in Edgartown and love going to Aalia's!

author: Ian Harrington
text: This is the restaurant that spiraled me into my purple sweet potato powder drink addiction. I‚Äôd never even heard of it until I came here. It‚Äôs one of my favorite beverages now to this day. I got the Lebanese breakfast and my wife got the wrap. The food is light and delicious. The hash browns are the best we‚Äôve ever eaten, they‚Äôre crisp patties that are fried. So good. We sat outside and got a great view to the street. Overall just a peaceful place and great way to start your day at the Vineyard!

author: Melissa Stankovich
text: I was looking for a breakfast spot on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard that had some gluten free options. We found Aalia‚Äôs through a Google search. I got the Lebanese Breakfast, which was mostly gluten free. It came with pita bread, which I gave to my husband. But the eggs were great. They came with a bed of arugula that was fresh and bright. The macha latte was beautifully crafted and delicious.

author: Barsnobs
text: Great coffee but a major wait time. It's crowded and small. If you sit, people will be breathing over you at your table. The coffee is worth the wait. The breakfast food looked amazing. Tell em Barsnobs sent ya!

author: Roman Jurkovic
text: Food was not good at all. Bagels were hard as rock, tuna salad was less then an average (I bet you can do better yourself). Lox bagel was ok, but nothing crazy or fancy like this place want to look/be. Platter was the best meal but again, nothing I would come back for. We did breakfast menu only. Coffee was good though. Get drink only and go eat somewhere else. They have nice seating inside and outside covered patio. Right on the busy back street. You wont find calm place to enjoy drink/meal here. Prices are normal.

author: Kiera Nemsick
text: I just had my first salad from MV Salads and it was everything I could have hoped for! It took me forever to decide on what to get because everything looked and sounded so good. I went with the JAWS special, which creatively incorporated aspects of the movie JAWS in salad toppings (shark tooth shaped turnips and beets mixed in the amazing MV Salads dressing to make it look like blood). So creative! In addition to the great food, Susanna (the owner) and her staff are so inviting. The kindness is truly contagious üòä

author: mathsweat
text: I came to Oak Bluffs for vacation last week and ordered the MV BLT salad. While I usually am not a salad person, this was exceptionally delicious and I will definitely be returning next year to get have the MV BLT again and to try some of their other salads. Furthermore, the woman creating my salad was very accommodating of my nut allergy by changing gloves beforehand. The cornbread as an extra touch is great as well!

author: Grace Hughes
text: Me and my sister‚Äôs favorite food place in MV! Not only are the workers wonderful and kind, but the salads are beyond delicious!! I stop there every year and it‚Äôs just as good every time. 10/10 recommend!!!

author: Danielle Lewis
text: This is the best salad i‚Äôve ever had! You can taste the quality of each ingredient. Obsessed with this place, the staff and that little corn muffin :) A must every time i‚Äôm on island!

author: Jeremy Medford
text:
MV salads does not disappoint. The owner, Susanna Herlitz-Ferguson, answered our questions, ensured the staff adequately took our order and made sure we were satisfied with every last bite. The salad options presented at MV Salads are unique, memorable, and delicious. We ended up ordering 2 different salad options. The house made dressings are crave-worthy. The house crafted juices are works of art by themselves.

The atmosphere is exquisite. Well done Susanna and staff!

author: Connor McMorrow
text: Atria in Edgartown delivered a killer night out - we were down in the Cellar and the vibe was on point. It‚Äôs got that cozy-meets-cool energy, with a DJ spinning and setting the tone without overpowering the room. We kicked things off with a round of great cocktails and then dove into the food - the burrata ravioli was rich and dreamy, the calamari was perfectly crispy with delicious aioli, and we tried a lineup of burgers that did not disappoint. The Cellar feels like a hidden gem under one of the island‚Äôs classic spot - laid-back but still polished, and a super fun place to post up for dinner or drinks.

author: Tara Schalick
text:
I've been to Atria a number of times over the years and their food and service is always great- however the last couple of visits the level of hospitality has been really impressive. I recently went with 4 other women, all new moms, and had put that little note in the reservation. We showed up to a lovely table with a handwritten note acknowledging our effort to get out of the house (5 new moms, no easy feat) and were given a server who definitely understood the assignment! (I believe her name was Amanda) she was fun and made sure to suggest fun drinks for us, as well as great menu suggestions.
The next time upon returning we dined outside at the fire pit table, and the GM recognized our baby from a previous visit and brought him out a onesie! These thoughtful gestures, as well as the outstanding hospitality consistently displayed by the entire staff are what set Atria apart!

author: Mckenzie
text: went here for a birthday dinner and had an amazing time. everything was excellent, the service was amazing and the entire team made the night feel so special. I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. The drinks and food were divine.

author: Naim A
text:
Gorgeous restaurant in Edgartown. It‚Äôs a nice house with a gorgeous patio; pity we could not enjoy the outdoors due to the weather. It‚Äôs a little up the street from the main downtown next to a gas station.
Service is great and attentive. Everyone, including the GM, were professional, smily and courteous. They were also knowledgeable about the menu.

The downside however is the food.. If it was a normally priced place, I would have given them a pass, but for those prices there is no room for error.
We had crab cake and calamari for starters; they were very good and the calamari had a great spicy kick. We were four , we had 2 swordfish, one halibut and one lobster.  Those mains were very average. I was so looking forward to getting a halibut; the piece was small and dry ;lacked flavor. It was served on some cherry tomatoes, with a dressing and lobster meat, again there was clearly something missing.
My friends also were disappointed by their entrees.
Insance prices, including for the drinks; like a 22$ plus for.a martini, 7 $ for the bread. It‚Äôs a very expensive place but the food does not match unfortunately.

author: Camnor 4
text: We took my parents here for their 50th anniversary. I had a reservation and told them beforehand. When we got to the table there was an anniversary card on the table which was very sweet. Excellent service from the moment we walked in. Lots of servers helping each other. I wish we had a table outside because the outdoor seating was also gorgeous. The food was absolutely delicious

author: Lisa L
text: Whole lobster with a corn on the cob was the Tuesday special for twenty five dollars. Steak sandwich with fries under twenty dollars. Simple and perfect. Fresh lobster, real steak on a roll, sides,beverages, a view, service. 10/10. Great way to end our visit.

author: Barbara Cheney
text:
Tiny, open-air spot right on the harbor with cold beer, delicious comfort food, and the friendliest staff. We came for the soccer game and were treated like family. My brother-in-law, fresh off a shift in the harbor and needing something gluten-free, was taken care of with a custom plate from the chef‚Äîno fuss, just kindness.

Only a few tables, mostly locals, and everyone‚Äîfrom the servers to the kitchen‚Äîmade the place feel like home. This is the kind of spot you want to find, but only if you know where to look.

author: Perry Young
text:
One of our favorite stops on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard! We weren‚Äôt planning on sitting down, but after the owner greeted us and told us about their BBQ Wednesdays, we decided to grab a seat‚Äîand we‚Äôre so glad we did. We had a beer, the basket of fries, and the coconut shrimp‚Ä¶ which my girlfriend said was the best she‚Äôs ever had. She swore she can never eat coconut shrimp again unless it‚Äôs from Coop de Ville.

Our server, who was originally from Jamaica, was incredibly kind and welcoming, and the whole vibe was just unmatched‚Äîgreat reggae music, amazing views of the Oak Bluffs harbor, and a laid-back energy that made us want to stay for hours.

The owner mentioned he‚Äôs been running the place for 30+ years, and you can feel the love and history in every corner. We‚Äôll be back every year we visit the island. Absolutely recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre anywhere near Oak Bluffs. üå¥üç§üçª

author: Margaret Johnson
text: Coop de ville is easily the chilliest most best spot in Oak Bluffs. Came here on our first day for some beers and snacks. The staff was awesome! We really felt at home. We even stopped by after our fishing trip and Shamel , the chef cooked our Bonito fish Jamaican and Cajun style. IT ROCKED!!! Well be back every year and maybe another couple times this week !!

author: Carly Burns
text: I got the Maryland style dry rub wings and fries. The wings were too wet felt like they gave me wet instead of dry but still decent wings. I also got the fries which were shoestring (yum!) but they were not seasoned at all. Service was great my waitress was super nice and even filled my waterbottle at the end. Atmosphere is very fun, I‚Äôd recommend for the vibe and a drink but would not recommend the food it was only mediocre. Wings, fries, and soda were $33 which is not too bad for MV!

author: Lisa DeWitt
text: Travellers, this is a small, charming and yummy breakfast restaurant. The menu is large with a variety of selections including eggs Benedict on cod cakes and chicken sausages offered for breakfast. The eggs Benedict on cod cakes was delicious but needed a fresh component to break through the fat. The cod cake was perfectly cooked and so was the poached eggs. It came on a fluffy biscuit. Service is with a smile so if you‚Äôre in the area check it out. We recommend.

author: Sidney Brown
text: We caught them right before they closed for the season, as we tried to go back and they were gone! Chicken sausage, eggs, toast and grits, while my daughter had pancakes. Tasty breakfast and the softest biscuits I've ever had in my life! Worth the trip if you're ever in town.

author: Angie
text: I  had great food and service.  The atmosphere was family friendly the host and servers were very friendly.  I have to say the cheesy grits were my favorite.  The home fries were made like nothing ive had before, it was amazing. They tasted like home.

author: Cassandra Wilson
text: This place was 100 percent worth the wait! Some tips, just wait because the line goes faster than  he you think!  The pictures DO NOT the food justice but its sooo good! The bisquit benedict was sooooo good! It was well seasoned!  Please keep in mind there is no actual bathroom in the restaurant ! Use restroom before hand but its worth it! The owner was sooo nice! He even took a picture with usü•∞

author: Martin McAdam
text: I know some of the reviews here are not so good but I had a fantastic breakfast at Biscuits. The staff are brilliant. The American diner style food was amazing. They have a slightly older clientele but this was shoulder season and you know the grey hairs seek value and quality.

author: Saurav Jain
text: Delicious Thai food with great vegan and gluten free options! Loved the Red Curry, Pineapple Fried Rice, and Pad Thai. Place could use a little update, but the flavors and service make it a solid 5 stars.

author: Steven Ballot
text: My friend and I went to dinner here and at the time we were the only two patrons.  We were warmly greeted by the owners and were promptly sat by the window.  We ordered our drinks and apps and they came in just a couple minutes.  For dinner I had the seafood pad Thai.  I ordered it as 3 star spicy, the hottest they offered.  It came to the table and it was presented nicely on the plate.  The texture was perfect to my liking and the heat made the dish exceptional. I have a high heat tolerance so it was not too spicy for me personally, but it truly enhanced the dish.  It was bursting with flavor.  As we finished, the restaurant was filling up with patrons and every one was greeted with a smile and warm welcome.  This restaurant is a must try.

author: Susanna Herlitz-Ferguson
text:
Bangkok Thai in Oak Bluffs is truly a gem ‚Äî and it's amazing to see them celebrating 20 years in business! This spot has been one of my favorite places on Martha's Vineyard for as long as I can remember. I often come here solo for a quiet, delicious meal, and it never disappoints. The dishes are consistently outstanding - fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented.
And I always end with their sticky rice and mango ‚Äî the perfect finish to a perfect meal. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting.
Here's to many more years of Bangkok Thai on the Vineyard!

author: Marnely Murray
text: This is my go to spot for when I am craving spicy and delicious Thai food - but note that there are a lot of non spicy dishes as well! Honestly, I have had so many dishes over the year here and every one of them is delicious. Perfect for a cozy meal on Martha's Vineyard!

author: Prachi
text: Cutest place with super tasty food. They are really accommodating with dietary restrictions! Don't miss this place if you're around

author: Ethan Shoe
text:
Had a good experience at Nat's Nook. My main purpose for visiting was to have a place to work remotely for the day. It's a great spot except for the fact that there is one power outlet in the entire place, and it's outside. So if you don't get the one table that's near the outlet, you can't really work from here unless your battery lasts as long as you need.

Otherwise, it's a great spot with good, albeit super expensive cafe food.

author: Gopal Gantayat
text: Great little rustic cafe with a nice selection of crepes. They have many gluten free and vegan options.

author: T. Nelson
text:
04.11.2025
This is a very cute quaint place. The atmosphere is relaxed and the decor is like a cottage. I got a vanilla chai tea latte with almond milk. It is so good.

author: Stebs
text: Really liked this place. Its super cute, centrally located and has great indoor and outdoor seating. The coffee is fantastic (I had a cold brew) and the breakfast bagel was delicious. The staff was very sweet.

author: Christopher Stevens (Chris)
text: I love Nat's book.  It is aptly named as a Nook so if you don't look for it, you may not find it.  The Crepes are a great casual breakfast, together with fresh coffee (iced coffee cubes are cool).  It is often less crowded than the more touristy places in Vineyard haven and it is common to see a few laptops out.  There is both indoor and outdoor seating.  The bathrooms are clean and there is a hint of home TLC in the design with literature quotes on the walls.  If you want good coffee and a casual and reasonably priced meal in Vineyard Haven and desire to avoid lines - find the Nook.

author: Melissa Lee
text:
A Culinary Gem That Outshines Even the View ‚Äì Bettini at Harbor View Hotel
Bettini at the Harbor View Hotel is one of those rare places where the food, service, and setting harmonize so perfectly that you almost forget which one impressed you first. Yes, the view of Edgartown Harbor is breathtaking ‚Äî the kind that glows in the golden light of Martha‚Äôs Vineyard ‚Äî but here, it‚Äôs the food that truly steals the show.

Under the remarkable leadership of Executive Chef Juan Martinez and Sous Chef Momo Camara, every plate is crafted with soul and precision. The scallop crudo was a masterpiece of restraint ‚Äî impossibly fresh, delicate, kissed with just the right acidity to let the sea speak for itself. The lobster bucatini came next, beautifully balanced with a subtle kick that added warmth without overwhelming the sweet richness of the lobster. And then, the beef carpaccio ‚Äî paper-thin, melt-in-your-mouth tender, and bursting with flavor in every bite.

Service was flawless from start to finish. Our bartender Taylor made the most beautiful hot cocoa for my daughter ‚Äî just the right temperature, velvety, and not too hot ‚Äî proof of the team‚Äôs thoughtful attention to detail. Andrei, our server, was both attentive and genuinely funny, effortlessly remembering each of my kids‚Äô names after our very first dinner. That kind of personal touch transforms a meal into a memory.

Bettini isn‚Äôt just a hotel restaurant ‚Äî it‚Äôs a culinary destination in its own right. Whether you come for the harbor views, the impeccable service, or the artistry on your plate, you‚Äôll leave knowing you‚Äôve just experienced something special.

author: Sehin Belew
text:
A Truly Unforgettable Dining Experience at Bettini

Dining at Bettini Restaurant was one of the most meaningful and beautiful experiences I've ever had. Located in the stunning Harbor View Hotel in Martha‚Äôs Vineyard, the atmosphere was breathtaking ‚Äî with luxurious decor and a serene view of the water that set the perfect tone for the evening.

I had mentioned in advance that it was my mother‚Äôs birthday ‚Äî though she is now in heaven, I celebrate her every year. What the team at Bettini did for me moved me to tears. When I sat down, they handed me a personalized menu created in honor of my mom. It was such a thoughtful and unexpected gesture. They even told me I could take the menu home, which I will treasure forever.

The food was absolutely amazing, every bite was perfect. To top it all off, they brought out a beautiful birthday dessert with a chocolate ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù plaque and a tall candle. It felt like they celebrated her with me.

To say I had an amazing time would be an understatement. Bettini is not just a restaurant ‚Äî it's a place that touches your heart. Thank you to the entire staff for making my evening so special.

author: Shored Up Digital
text:
We had an incredible experience at Bettini, made even more memorable by the outstanding service from bartenders Hunter and Taylor. We were celebrating my friend's new job in LA, so we wanted somewhere we could feel extra special celebrating.

Sitting at the bar was the perfect choice ‚Äî the atmosphere was welcoming, the conversation flowed easily, and the bartenders professionalism truly stood out. Hunter crafted what was hands down the best espresso martini we‚Äôve ever had, setting the tone for a fantastic evening. Taylor made us one of the signature cocktails of Bettini as well and truly - another five star drink to start the night. The ambiance at Bettini strikes a perfect balance between elegant and inviting, making it an ideal spot for a relaxed yet elevated night out.

The food was equally impressive. We started with the beef skewers, which were incredibly tender, and the shrimp empanadas, which were perfectly crisp and flavorful. The gnocchi with wild mushrooms and truffle was a standout ‚Äî rich, decadent, and absolutely delicious. The chicken dish was spectacular, beautifully cooked and full of flavor. We ended on a sweet note with the chocolate torte, a lovely finish to an unforgettable meal. If you're visiting Edgartown, a meal at Bettini is a must and we highly recommend grabbing a seat at the bar ‚Äî between the amazing service, exquisite food, and lively ambiance, it‚Äôs an experience you won‚Äôt want to miss. Taylor and Hunter are true professionals and we look forward to coming in again and telling all our friends about our experience!

author: Chana Spielberg
text: Our favorite place on the Vineyard! They made our anniversary dinner super special this evening! Luciana was so kind and attentive.

author: Jess Gorbet
text: The food and ambiance are wonderful. Try the lobster bucatini, you won't be disappointed. Request Alex as your server, he is so attentive and thoughtful. He made my birthday so special!

author: Breana Bethany
text: Love coming here every year for my morning coffee! This year I bought the clear tumbler and you get a free drink in it!! Food and coffee is amazing, and the store is super cute located underground. You should stop by if your in the area.

author: Priya P.
text:
Great breakfast had of mocha latte and veggie cream cheese (added fresh cucumber slices) on (toasted) asiago cheese bagel. üòã

All staff were very friendly and happy themselves ‚Ä¶ good vibes! Yeah, it‚Äôs raining men!

author: K P
text: The coffee was just okay ‚Äî I was hoping for a bit more flavor. The ganache brownie was good, but it was wrapped in thin plastic wrap, which made it messy to take on the go and melted quickly in the heat. It also stuck to the brownie and affected the texture. A paper wrap or small bag would make a much better option for packaging.

author: Matt Daniel
text: Wow, I can see why so many people love this place! The staff is beyond friendly and friendly works extremely hard to get everyone‚Äôs drinks and food out in a short amount of time. The bagel and coffee I had were delicious. This has to be the first stop for everyone coming into Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. Hope this helps!

author: Matt H
text: Got a hot coffee and chai tea here and was very satisfied. Located in a quaint little shop on the middle of oak bluffs, it was the perfect spot for a morning pick me up. The shop is a little small so don‚Äôt be surprised if it‚Äôs hard to maneuver in there as it gets pretty busy.

author: Robert H.
text: Really cool restaurant bar with huge outdoor area much of it covered. Games to play while you listen to live bands. Probably one of our favorite places in our one week trip to the island.

author: Tisha Burgess
text:
Amazing Oysters & Laid-Back Island Vibes

Our first attempt to visit Nomans was on a Friday night‚Äîunknowingly right when it seemed like everyone on the island had the same idea! We decided to try again on Saturday afternoon, and I‚Äôm so glad we did. The vibes were still popping, but without the long wait.

Molly, the bartender, was fantastic‚Äîfriendly, welcoming, and pouring some truly delicious drinks. We enjoyed a couple of Mai Tais and a strong Old Fashioned before diving into the main event: the oysters. And let me tell you‚Ä¶ these were AH-mazing‚Äîso fresh, so tasty, just downright guuud! We started with a half dozen, but they were so good we had to order another half dozen. I can honestly say these are probably the best oysters I‚Äôve had to date.

Our kids enjoyed playing a few games while we relaxed, and we also tried the cod sandwich‚Äîperfectly cooked, with a flavorful aioli that really stood out. The fries were fresh, hot, and tasty. The music (not live) added to the already chill, island vibe, making it even easier to kick back and enjoy the afternoon.

I‚Äôm so glad our plans shifted to Saturday instead of Friday‚Äîit made for the perfect, laid-back island experience. We‚Äôll definitely be back!

author: Miss Wells
text:
We came here on a late Friday afternoon to dance, have some food & drinks, and listen to the DJ. Nomads now charges a $10 entry fee ($12 if you use a credit card), as of the 2025 season. Seating was limited so we had to stand for a bit before we were able to find a place to sit.

There were reserved sections on the patio and out on the lawn. We eventually found seats with a table and ordered appetizers and drinks. There was a couple of corn hole games outside which kept some of the children that were present, occupied.  The DJ played a variety of music that kept everyone on the dance floor. A good time was had.

author: Katie Eichinger
text: Such a cute spot between Edgartown and Oak Bluffs. Awesome to-go options for the beach are eating on site. There are yard games like connect four and cornhole, and an outdoor TV where we watched an NFL game. A really great value for the food we had also: hotdog and chicken sando were delish and the fries were piping hot.

author: Jonathan Stallsmith
text:
Noman‚Äôs has become an annual outing during our vacation.  It streamlines food and drink orders by offering counter service.  This allows them to service many customers in a short period of time.

It‚Äôs amazing to see retirees enjoying a meal together while kids run circles around the tables.  The atmosphere is laid back, which makes it suitable and welcoming to all.  They have great music, tasty food, a raw bar, and a wide selection of drinks.  Seating is first-come, first-served, so you may need to stake out your location.  Parking can also be difficult, and they offer an off-site shuttle service.

Food in the photo includes short rib tacos (left), kale salad (right), and potato salad (back).

author: N F
text: Delicious food with fresh ingredients. We ordered the spicy cucumber salad, which beat expectations, the olive spread, and halibut. The halibut had a beautiful salty crust and was cooked perfectly.   For dessert, we ordered the honey pie, which was light and not overally sweet, and was paired with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It's definitely worth checking out.

author: antoinette rodney
text: I would give The Covington more than 5 stars if I could! The decor is simple and elegant, but the food is out of this world. We shared the fish special (meant for 2-3 people) and it was perfect for two of us with big appetites. We also enjoyed the sweet and spicy cucumbers, marinated olives, halibut tartare, and the honey pie. I'm a dessert connoisseur, and this honey pie did not disappoint me!

author: Tara Clapper
text: I now have a new favorite restaurant! Covington has exceptional staff, amazing flavors and combinations, top notch freshness, and is an all-around fantastic place. We actually went back for dinner here during our four night stay because it was that good, and we wanted to try the other dishes. We shared the sweet potato rolls, squash and beans, smoked beets, garden salad, basil and walnut pesto ricotta gnocchi, and mushroom ragu. All were amazingly delicious and presented quickly and beautifully. Both evenings we dined outside at a lovely little side table. This place is hard to beat! I would give it six stars if I could.

author: Kathieya Bell
text: 10/10 recommend grabbing dinner here if you can. I‚Äôm not one to order bolognese but it was delicious as well as the seafood fettuccine. I‚Äôll be returning every year.

author: Ren Henry
text:
This place was so delicious. Drink service was incredible and included a wonderful rum selection.

Food was creative and delicious. No food allergy issues for me here! Accommodating.

author: Grace Hagerty
text:
A True Martha‚Äôs Vineyard Gem!

The Chilmark General Store is the heart of the community and an absolute treasure on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. Whether you‚Äôre grabbing a fresh coffee in the morning, picking up one of their legendary pizzas, or just browsing the well-curated selection of local goods and essentials, this place has everything you need. The porch is the perfect gathering spot ‚Äî relaxed, welcoming, and full of island charm. The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the vibe is as authentic as it gets. A perfect stop for locals and visitors alike. Can't wait to go back!

author: Meiqian He
text:
I would really like to say something nice, unfortunately, we had a not so good experience here. My parents and I stopped by this store while exploring the area and ordered 3 slices of pizza and 2 cups of hot tea. The pizza slices seemed old and the crust was tough‚Äîmaybe a whole fresh pizza would‚Äôve been better.
After a long day of walking, we asked for a simple refill of hot water for our tea cups. A young staff member was initially willing, but after a word from an older woman (likely the manager), she told us they don‚Äôt do tea refills. I asked if we could pay for just hot water, and after some hesitation, the young staff member kindly gave us the refill without charge.

I appreciated her willingness to help, but I was disappointed by the manager‚Äôs refusal‚Äîespecially since it was just hot water for my 80-year-old dad. A little kindness goes a long way. I hope she would not treat other old people this way.

author: Maggie J
text: Cute general store! We stopped in to pick up lunch on the way to Larsen‚Äôs because I don‚Äôt eat lobster. The store has a good selection of groceries but I was there for the prepared foods. Lots of choices for salads, sandwiches and ready to heat meals. I opted for the Greek salad and a slice of veggie pizza. I was a little disappointed to find out the veggies on the pizza were just tomatoes, so basically a Margherita pizza with pesto. The salad was fresh and had a good dressing on the side but I thought the pizza was only ok. Still a great grab and go option.

author: Ed Holden
text: Nice general store with provisions, goodies, swag, and a coffee shop with artisan pizzeria. The coffee is excellent. The pizza is really solid: nice dry crust that's chewy and crispy and flavorful in all the right ways, and a decidedly "New York slice" blend of sauce and cheese. Each pie we ordered came out splendidly, and I'm told the gluten free crust was much better than average for that category. Be warned: prices are steep because this is an island. Our three pizzas cost about $90.

author: Mat Sunderland (Sunders ont road)
text: Oh hell. If you are in America and are English then this is well worth the visit. For every one else also stop by. Was advised to wait for a bus by the amazing bus driver and so ordered a coffee and sat on the porch‚Ä¶ in a rocking chair. I kid you not. I sat on a general stores porch h drinking fine coffee n a rocking chair. I mean how much more American do you want. Fantastic.

author: Maggie J
text: Nice market with a good selection of produce and dry goods along with fresh baked goods and prepared foods to go. Not as extensive of a selection as some of the other markets but still a great place to pick up fresh ingredients for all your cooking needs.

author: Shored Up Digital
text:
Our team gives Morning Glory Farm five stars. Our go-tos: the banana bread (moist, not too sweet), sesame noodles (perfect grab-and-go), and sourdough (crackly crust, chewy crumb). The staff is consistently friendly and helpful, even during rushes.

Bonus: the rocking chairs on the porch are perfect for catching up on emails while enjoying a local snack. A must-stop for both locals and visitors.

author: Annie Arthur Lightbody
text: Best produce on the island! Great baked goods and prepared foods. Lovely regular events (always check their social media). Kind and informed staff. Beautiful displays and sweet gifts as well.

author: Marnely Murray
text: Morning Glory Farm is one of the best farms on island in my opinion. A family farm, they supply ingredients to so many island homes and restaurants.
