Thankful because I live just five minutes away! If you're visiting, it's a must because it's a great spot to stock up for food if you're staying in a rental and wanting to cook local island produce. Also a great farm stand to pick up beach food - they have everything from a delicious salad bar to baked goods, cheeses, crackers, charcuterie, and so much more. Need peanut butter? They grind their own and it comes in a glass jar (yei no plastic!); need flowers for a dinner, they have them; want some beach plum jam, they make their own -  also their strawberry jam is amazing! Plus they have ready. to eat dinners like tacos, meatloaf, macaroni and cheese, and so much more, easy to reheat when you're on the go. Morning Glory Farm - definitely a favorite on island!

author: Dan Colucci
text: Accessible off the bike trail or by car, Morning Glory Farm serves breakfast pastries and also has a great selection of vegetables, breads,meats and fruit. Seasonal outdoor decor too

author: Keep Life Simple Allan
text: We stopped in for drinks and then again for lunch. The drinks were delicious. We both had burgers for lunch and they were excellent.The servers were both nice and made suggestions.

author: asya deriy
text: best restaurant!! khelsea was so attentive, so sweet and friendly. i felt really heard and enjoyed the food! everything was brought in quick, food is delicious, best lobster roll ever, highly recommend this place and our server! margaritas are nice and strong!

author: Sharon Davis
text: Andrea was the best waitress ever!! So attentive and personal . Food was good though kitchen a bit slow but was really crowded. The pineapple mules made up for it !

author: Benjamin Daniels
text: The fish tacos were terrible. Literally a frozen fish stick, which must be pretty embarrassing for this place because they charged $30 for that meal and claim to be a fish place. The fish stick in my taco makes an audible sound when knocked against the table. It was surprising because the fish and chips were decent and freshly made. The lobster Mac and cheese was good.

author: Tina Morgan
text: Randy brought me the most amazing lobster roll ever!   It‚Äôs packed with juicy meat!  And for once I didn‚Äôt need more butter.   I‚Äôm a lobster roll snob and this one knocked it out of the park.  Thank you Randy!

author: Marnely Murray
text: The new food offerings at the Ritz in OB by Chef Canieka at the Loud Kitchen Experience are truly SO DELICIOUS! Everything was flavorful, on point, and executed great! We ordered the beef sliders with slaw, the mooniest fries, the cajun corn, the sweet fritters, and the Mac and cheese! Prices were reasonable and flavor was out of this world! A must try in OB!

author: Angela P
text: Very important to know that Dilly's is located inside the Ritz!! It's a dark bar but honestly I loved the atmosphere! Sophia was a great bartender; casual, friendly, helpful. The rice bowls were AMAZING. Next time we're in MV we'll have to go at night to experience the "night life", but it was a great quick lunch before our ferry! @amp_eats (instagram)

author: Soumya Saha
text: We were relieved to find this place open as most of the restaurants in Oak Bluffs of Martha's Vineyard were closed during the winters. We were really hungry and thus ordered Shrimp Quesadillas, Buffalo Chicken Wings and 5$  burgers. Shrimp Quesadillas were really great and exactly what we needed to have at that moment. The hospitality was nice and the place had some cool music running too.

author: Steven Ballot
text: This bar is an icon in Oak Bluffs, Martha‚Äôs Vinyard. We went for a glass of wine and to just hang out.  I loved the vibe and the staff.  The bar tender/ manager is just a very nice woman who never stops smiling and does a great job managing the bar and surrounding tables.  We had already had dinner so just the wine on this night but it is place I‚Äôd want to keep going back to for sure.

author: Kareem Alston-Rosales
text: Food was aight. Can't complain too much for a late night spot. The music was good and had a decent beer selection. Gets pretty crowded but no complaints about the service either.

author: Ron Rogers
text:
I‚Äôm not sure why the reviews are poor. The service is good. The large deck offers nice views. The food is pretty solid for a place that it doesn‚Äôt have to be. We ordered raw oysters 3.5/5 (small), shrimp cocktail 4/5, Caesar salad 4/5, warm buttered lobster roll 4/5, PAN ROASTED MISO SALMON 5/5, and Boston cream pie 3/5 (dry).

Good beer, wine, and cocktail options.

author: Scott Scheleur
text: Arrived at 6:00 pm on a cloudy Wednesday evening and were seated upstairs in the open air seating. Wonderful views over the harbor and you can watch the Chappy ferry on its constant back and forth journey. Service was good. The lobster roll was served with fries and had lots of chunk lobster ‚Äì seemed to be a good value.  The Clam Chowder had a good flavor and was very creamy.  The fried shrimp platter was okay, but seemed a bit overpriced for the amount of shrimp. The winner was the lobster dip appetizer, served with lots of crispy pita bread. We also loved the Ocean Berry Booze cocktail. Would go back for the dip, cocktail and the great views. Outside seating was very full when we left around 7:30 pm.

author: Meydad Feldman
text: Very nice place, if you catch a good weather and get a seat outside, the view is incredible. The food was good, not amazing. A little bit over priced but still worth the experience.

author: John Gilliland
text: Great food, great service and great location. Enjoyed the lobster roll and the fisherman's platter. Loved it so much we went twice in the same week!

author: Steven Ballot
text: This restaurant is a great spot to watch the boats and ferry to Chappy.  We started out with a berry lemonade drink which was very refreshing and delicious. We had the lobster dip app which came with warm pita chips. The dip itself was loaded with fresh lobster and was mouth watering spectacular.  I ordered  lobster roll in butter accompanied with fries.  The lobster was sweet and tender as it should be.  It was heavenly good.  Our waitress was smiling, friendly and just an all around great waitress.  She checked back with us often and we appreciated her efforts.

author: G. Hauray
text: Cozy Corner is exactly what the name suggests. It is very comfortable to relax on the sofas, read the local newspaper, and meet people in the neighborhood, all while enjoying great coffee and food. The cappuccinos are creamy and rich, the smoothies are fresh, and the sandwiches are delicious. It‚Äôs a great spot!

author: Brian O'Malley
text: Cozy Corner Cafe is a gem! The staff is always warm and welcoming, making every visit a great experience. Their lattes are absolutely incredible‚Äîsmooth, rich, and perfectly crafted. The food is just as impressive, with fresh, flavorful choices that never disappoint. The atmosphere is ideal for getting some work done or simply connecting with the community. Whether you‚Äôre stopping by for a quick coffee or settling in for a productive afternoon, this place delivers five-star service every time!

author: Marnely Murray
text: Cozy Corner Cafe is exactly what the name suggests‚Äîwarm, welcoming, and the perfect place to settle in with a great cup of coffee. Their cortados are spot on, perfectly balanced and smooth, and the freshly baked goods are always a treat. Whether you need a quick bite or a quiet spot to work for a few hours, this cafe has the ideal mix of great atmosphere, friendly service, and quality coffee. Highly recommend!

author: Shivi D.
text:
This place is super cute!

The gentleman working at the cash register was very sweet, welcoming and friendly.

I ordered the steak quesadilla on special and my friend got the pork "burrito".
The burrito was advertised as pulled pork, avocado, onions and tomatoes.

I wish places who used bagged avocado mush would advertise the correct product, you can't say the burrito comes with avocado and then when the burrito comes out it's half guacamole.
It's very deceptive and that bagged avocado taste DISGUSTING, so the whole burrito went in the trash :(

Steak had some good flavor, but only about half of the "quesadilla" actually had meat in it, it was just a very thick layer of cheese that had not even been melted all the way.

My quesadilla was so soggy, I could barely even lift it out of the box.

I think we spent close to $50 here and then still had to go get food elsewhere after.

Very disappointing!

author: Susanna Herlitz-Ferguson
text:
Cozy Corner Caf√© Is So Much More Than Coffee, and Iggy is the most welcoming host and owner.
This European-style caf√© offers a warm, welcoming vibe that always makes me want to linger ‚Äî whether catching up with friends or just taking a moment for myself.
The coffee and teas are absolutely top-tier ‚Äî but don‚Äôt miss out on the food. Their sandwiches are fresh and flavorful, the a√ßa√≠ bowls are refreshing and beautifully made, and every bite feels like a treat.
Can‚Äôt recommend it enough ‚Äî Cozy Corner Caf√© is a true local treasure.

author: Dulce Plumb
text: After all the hype about this place from guide books and travel magazines, I can‚Äôt believe how bad it was. There was nothing interesting or original in the menu and when I finally chose something the resulting dish was not only underwhelming but just plain blah. I think the pictures speak for themselves.

author: P Hord
text:
We decided to dine at Alchemy Bistro and Bar based off of recommendations frim locals.  The atmosphere is modern with dim lighting for dinner.  It was quiet season so there was no issue with getting a reservation.

The meal and experience was okay.  The Roasted Chicken dish collard greens were way too salty. Nothing special about the chicken.  Atlantic Halibut was okay. The best item was the Shrimp and Sausage scampi.
Overall it was just okay.

author: Andrew Westbrook
text: Excellent service.  The menu was short, though everything on it seemed well-designed.  Unfortunately, everything was way too salty to enjoy properly.  The fried oysters were nothing special -- fried for too long and then covered in too much barbecue sauce.  The quality of the fish and lobster was excellent, but again bathed in too much salty sauce.

author: Korynn Lima
text: Delicious and a true gem of MV. Staff were attentive and made sure we enjoyed our dinner. Would come again!

author: Deepank Korandla
text:
We went to the Alchemy for dinner on a Friday night. The place was very busy and a bit loud, which is to be expected.

The cocktails at this place are really good. We got the Arbuz and a mojito.

The mixed berry jam that came with the cheese plate was so good that I would recommend getting that appetizer solely for that reason.

Out of the three entrees we got, the campanelle pasta (with sun-dried tomato & walnut pesto) was the star and the favorite of everyone at the table. We also got the halibut and chicken which were still tasty even if they weren't as good as the pasta.

The mango strawberry cheesecake we got for dessert was also delicious, would recommend.

author: Ron Rogers
text: This was our favorite place to eat in Edgartown. Open air cafe with flowers all around. The staff is friendly and helpful. The food is very good. We ordered avocado toast 5/5 and corned beef hash with eggs 5/5. They house make the corned beef. Highly recommend. We ate here twice in three days.

author: Taras Martiniouk
text: Coffee is good, food is ok, vibes cute but busy! Overall not a bad vibe and in the middle of town. Toast wasn‚Äôt toasted üòÇüòÇ had to ask ! Eggs were eh, hash was ok.

author: Max F
text:
Another wonderful experience. We've been coming here every time we visit MV. Always great food,great service.
Thank you again!

author: Steve Kotten
text: Best breakfast/lunch spot on MV!! Downtown Edgartown near the waterfront, this place has the most delicious and freshest food. Great sandwiches and breakfast dishes along with amazing smoothies like the Peanut Butter Perk! Must go if you‚Äôre on MV.

author: Micheal Castillo
text: The Belgium Waffle was deliciously crispy and moist at the same time. The waitress for very friendly and attentive. Even got me a small bowl so I could give my dogs water.

author: Grace Hagerty
text:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Tony's Market in Oak Bluffs is an absolute treasure trove of delights! From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a tantalizing array of options that you never knew you needed until now. Whether you're craving a gourmet sandwich from their deli, browsing through their impressive selection of wines and beers, or indulging in freshly baked goods, this market has it all.

One of the highlights is their dedication to local produce, offering the freshest fruits and vegetables that capture the essence of Martha's Vineyard. And let's not forget their well-stocked shelves of newspapers and magazines, perfect for grabbing a read while enjoying a delicious snack.

Tony's Market isn't just a grocery store‚Äîit's an experience. The friendly staff, cozy atmosphere, and diverse offerings make it a must-visit destination for both locals and tourists alike. Trust me, you'll leave with more than just groceries‚Äîyou'll leave with a newfound appreciation for the finer things in life.

author: Morgan Fykes
text: Tony's is a great convenient market for all your grab and go needs!! They have a great selection of basics and a wonderful deli.  Thankful for Tonys in town!!

author: Tabitha Benjamin
text: If I could give this store zero stars, I would. Seem to have an attitude with every black person, particularly black woman that comes to their store. Every time I order something from them, they throw my food on the counter while giving me nasty stare downs. Energy is very off and they‚Äôre asking for a lawsuit.

author: Tristen Indigo
text: This store could improve its customer service. The staff interaction felt unfriendly and lacked basic communication. With better training, the experience could be much better.

author: Chris Cramton
text: Mostly positive, good selection but prices are high. Customer service has improved. Gets overly crowded in summer but usually wait times are short.

author: Audrie V
text: Had an excellent lunch , great quality ingredients, beautifully presented. Ceviche and steak tartare were delicious as was the prime rib sandwich. Cr√®me br√ªl√©e and cheese cake were fab too. Wine list was quite pricey.

author: Tilak Kalaria
text: An absolutely great experience was had dining at 19 Raw Oyster Bar and Steakhouse. The service was impeccable, the food was delicious and the menu was very friendly to many. I highly recommend dining here if visiting Edgartown and I‚Äôll be back for sure!!

author: Dana
text: The weather was amazing and we sat out in the deck. Our server, Katie, was delightful. Very informative, professional and welcoming. The food was over the top delicious. Hubby started with a Smoked Blackberry Old Fashion.  We had the Smoked Pork Belly with tomato jam and polenta to start. So yummy. I had the salmon and hubby had the Sushi Grade Tuna. Our sides that we shared were both amazing. The Truffle Dauphinoise Potatoes were to die for!  Brussels spouts were also delish. We passed on dessert only because we were stuffed. We will be going back before the end of our stay  highly recommend.

author: Kendall Richey
text: Came here alone for dinner just before 8 and was sat right away. Service was friendly and I was impressed by my servers knowledge of the different types of oysters on offer. She was also knowledgeable about allergies so I was confident ordering a fully gluten free meal including oysters, steak au poivre, mashed potatoes and jalapeno creamed corn.

author: James Gibson
text: Food is incredible and on an island where all the menus seem to clone one another, you won‚Äôt find these dishes anywhere else. The staff is amazing, friendly and knowledgeable. The VIBE is Creative, Fun and Delicious. I‚Äôd give it 10 stars if I could. Seriously, go here.

author: Louis Schornstein
text: Mad Martha‚Äôs is da bomb. Love this place. The ice cream is painstakingly hand crafted using the finest ingredients available. Each bite is a taste bud orgasm. The place is spotless clean. It even smells good. The team members are extremely friendly and courteous. The attention to detail includes insulated to go bags. It‚Äôs everything you need and want in homemade ice cream. Treat yourself and your family today. Ask for Johanna. She has the biggest smile. God Bless Blue & Gold! God Bless America! Remember Everyone Deployed Everyday!

author: WV Heather
text: I love Mad Martha‚Äôs! The workers are always so friendly and nice. Ice cream is flavorful and creamy. This is a must stop when in Edgartown

author: Mark Taylor
text: We stopped here for a quick treat after lunch. It wasn‚Äôt too busy on a Monday afternoon. We didn‚Äôt go too crazy with our choices, just some hot fudge sundaes. They were good. We will have to go back and try more.

author: Fatima Zoglio
text: I loved this place! The ice cream is so creamy and tasteful. I had the sinful chocolate flavor and I 100% recommend it! There is some seating inside, we were able to sit because it wasn‚Äôt busy. Not sure how busy it gets though!

author: Jenna Letterie
text: Mad Martha‚Äôs is amazing! I got the Sinful Chocolate and it was insanely good‚Äîsuper rich and creamy. The staff was so friendly and made the whole experience even better. Definitely coming back!

author: Kevin Giles
text:
This is a place where people meet up with babies in strollers. Very kind friendly.

I had to do EVERYTHING myself but they want you to Tip before even sipping a coffee or tasting the food. I find that bizarre!

The burrito was good, but its wrapped as if you are going to take it off of the premises.

Toilets were clean and the patio was well maintained.

author: Time Capture Production llc
text: Rosewater is a fantastic spot for a casual meal in Edgartown. The place was busy when I visited, but the service was efficient and quick ‚Äî a sign of how popular it is. As a first-time customer traveling for work, I wasn‚Äôt disappointed. The sandwich I ordered was excellent, full of flavor, and the coffee was just as good. It‚Äôs a great place to stop with the whole family, with both indoor and outdoor seating options. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in town and looking for a tasty bite with friendly, fast service.

author: Joseph Raczynski
text: The BLT was very well done! I'd recommend it. It's a pleasant place in town to eat outside on a delightful summer day.

author: Alexis C
text: Ate here everyday for almost a week when I visited the island.  My favorite was the Egg Sandwich - the homemade biscuit was so, so good!  I also had the Spicy Peanut Bowl and Kimchi Fried Rice which were just okay.  The Caesar Salad Wrap needs a little more Caesar dressing for flavor and it needs more lettuce so you're not biting mostly on tortilla wrap.  Chicken Sandwich was good. As for the drinks, the Matcha Latte I did not care for, but Chai Latte and Hot Chocolate were good.

author: Kathleen McDonough
text:
Hubby and I stopped by for breakfast. They had a small menu for breakfast and lunch but yummy choices! They had some gluten free bakery treats which was great for hubby!! I ordered bacon egg and cheese on a homemade English muffin. FYI they only have cheddar or goat cheese for cheese options. It was hot fresh and yummy.
Hubby had the loaded hash browns and added scrambled eggs but no sour cream. When I opened the container to take a picture it was not what I was expecting but hubby said it was good. It must have been because he did not share!! We will be back tomorrow for the gluten free treats!!Hubby also had a medium roast coffee he said it was good but loves cream in his coffee but he has yet to find cream on the island.

author: Seth Abramski
text:
Highly trained and attentive service staff. The cocktails were definitely a highlight with subtle flavors and presentation.
We ordered the shrimp cocktail and watermelon and feta salad as starters. The shrimp were healthy and flavorful and the feta salad had a generous portion of cheese which paired well with the balsamic glaze.
Our courses came out of the kitchen very quickly!
For our main course, I got the ossobuco. The flavor was very strong and savory, like a winter beef stew. The cavatelli was lightly baked which gave it a nice crunch.
My wife ordered the veal Parmesan and it was cooked to perfection. The plate it was served on was the size of a pizza lol. The portion was so massive that we ended up finishing it for lunch and breakfast the next day!
Our waiter Luke was so attentive and even treated us to shots of limoncello (as it is our honeymoon!)
Overall, I would say the food and service lives up to the reputation and id recommend Atlantic the next time you have something to celebrate.

author: Susan Macbeth
text: Absolutely Fabulous Culinary Experience! All our food was beautifully presented, fresh, tasty, and delicious.  Our server was friendly, exceptionally helpful and attentive. All the seafood we ordered was heavenly. Drinks were made to perfection. The atmosphere is sophisticated yet casual over looking the water. We loved it!

author: Kelli Costa
text:
My friends and I went on a girls trip to Martha‚Äôs Vineyard the weekend before Memorial Day and this restaurant did not disappoint.  From the service, to the atmosphere, to the food everything was outstanding! And the cocktails were out of this world!

One of my friends and I started with the grilled octopus and then she got the salmon dish. The rest of us had the roasted half chicken. Everything was great!

I was too full for dessert, but one of the girls got the cookies and milkshakes, and another friend got the Frutta Di Bosca which was a chocolate tart shell with vanilla sauce and berries. The desserts were divine. As we left the restaurant, every single staff member said goodbye to us. Our waiter was the BEST, Top-notch service.

author: Ethan Shoe
text: Had such a fantastic time here. Our server, Luke, was so friendly and helpful with menu recommendations. We sat outside at a table with a fire pit of sorts and it was perfect. We all shared the French fries and I also had a crab cake. Both were fantastic. The drinks that everyone had were good too. I got the Mint Condition and it was one of the best alcoholic drinks I've ever had.

author: John Gilliland
text: Food was amazing and so was the service. Quick and attentive. Really enjoyed the crab cake, lobster salad, lobster ravioli, and lobster macaroni and cheese. Atmosphere was superb.

author: claire werner
text: We spent an afternoon here on our vacation our to Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. The staff are very friendly and gave great recommendations! Special shoutout to Maddy and Matthew! The venue was beautiful and the food was excellent! We loved the cauliflower crust on the bacon pizza. Please get a sour beer on tap!

author: Lauren Irion
text: Bad Martha, was bad. The bacon pizza was nasty and the wings were even worse. The beer was ok. The only good thing about this place is their merch and outdoor dining. I hate leaving a place feeling like I was ripped off and that‚Äôs exactly how our group all felt at the end of our visit. Sadly, this was one big disappointment. What we spent here would have been a very nice meal out somewhere else. Truly a waste of time and money ubering all the way over here from the vineyard haven ferry.

author: Bradford Everly
text: One of my favorite places on the vineyard.  Great beer, great pizza, great outdoor setting to sit and chill.  Absolutely must visit each time I'm on island.

author: Amelia Lezcano
text: Came in on a rainy night needing some good food that wasn‚Äôt outrageously priced and was super satisfied. The pizza was awesome (we got a pepperoni well done) and the service was polite and speedy. There‚Äôs virtually no places in MV with great reviews for pizza so definitely will be coming back with more friends the next time we visit.

author: Phillip Salvador Lee
text:
I'm glad we made this stopover at Bad Martha's on Martha Vineyard.
The only main brewery on the island it was a must-try.
With plenty of beer selection, we chose to do a flight. My favorites were their Belgian Quad and Oyster stout.
As for food, oh boy, I highly recommend ordering their pizza, plenty of oozy goodness, and they don't cheap out on cheese.
Perfect marriage of beer and pizza.
Service was exceptional and plenty of outdoor seating on a lovely summer's day.

author: Sarah Newman
text: one of my first meals on the island and WOW! first of all, the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. my family and I were recommended the apricot salad to split (so amazing), and they were very accommodating with making some changes to fit dietary needs. for my main I ordered the cauliflower dish‚Ä¶ truly what dreams are made of. I will be dreaming about this meal for a long time. OH! and came back for coffee the following morning‚Äì highly recommend! üòã

author: Taras Martiniouk
text: Place itself is very very cute, is the food amazing, no, is it one of the better options on the island yes. The shakshuka is very American, not a bit of spice in it, but as NY‚Äôers we are privy to very good food. So for MV it earns a 4

author: Joseph Raczynski
text: Crazy busy in the summer! Fair selection of food with a nice outdoor seating area. You'll wait for your food once ordered. It's not cheap. The chicken sandwich was pretty tasty as was the chocolate chip cookie.

author: Thuy Tran
text: This was nice. I came here for a nice read while enjoying my coffee and breakfast. I ordered a catado coffee and a cold brew with a breakfast order of Shakshuka. The atmosphere was very relaxing in a very busy Cafe. The coffee was spot on, however the eggs in the Shakshuka was overcooked. I asked one of the staff if they could remake the order for the eggs to be runny and they immediately followed through with kindness. The 2nd time came back extremely mouthwatering with great flavors! The staff did circle around and check on me to see how it came out again and apologise. Thanks so much for the wonderful service! Will be back again!

author: Brenda Irani
text: Finally, a place on the vineyard that is offering something other than lobster rolls and crab cakes.  Nestled behind the local bookstore under canvas sails and oak trees, you can find this little gem of an eatery.  From mushroom tacos to Asian veg rice bowls, they offer a diverse selection of healthy and different food options that don‚Äôt include meat, fish or cheese.  Not exclusively vegan but def vegan friendly.  Quick service and relaxed vibe.

author: f oktay
text: Market section in front has lots of great options, including locally made items.  Menu options are quite varied which is nice.  The quality of the food is good, but not great. Fresh baked pastries are available but limited.  They do have bagels too.  Coffee is good and baristas know their game. They use locally roasted beans from East West I believe which is also nice.  Front staff not very friendly.

author: Vincent Errichetti (Taste of Massachusetts)
text:
Waterside Market on Martha's Vineyard is a must do for me for their amazing Lobster Eggs Benedict. Tangy Hollandaise sauce what lots of fresh Lobster, and yes they will use claw and knuckle meat so you get the sweetest bites. Add to that a beautiful wraparound porch and it's a great way to start your morning.
Waterside Market Visit Martha's Vineyard

author: Sean Morgan
text: The CAB was the star of the show. Such great flavor on it! The French Quarter, Lucy Vincent, and old bay fries were very good too. Great drink selection and good coffee as well. They had a lot of products on tables and shelves both from the island local and other regional retailers.

author: Michael Leake
text: Well stocked store with fresh menu, including breakfast all day, and cafe. We ordered a Red White and Green as well as a CAB, both prepared quickly and delicious! We also devoured a bag of the park truffle chips made in house. Ample seating inside, and they had a restroom for customers. Highly recommend!

author: Grace Hagerty
text: I had the pleasure of grabbing breakfast takeout and lattes from Waterside Market in Vineyard Haven, and it was an absolute delight! The breakfast options were fresh, flavorful, and perfectly portioned. The bagels were toasted just right, and the pastries were a wonderful treat. The lattes were expertly made‚Äîsmooth, rich, and just the right balance of coffee and milk. The staff was friendly and efficient, making the whole experience seamless. If you're in the area, Waterside Market is a must-visit for a delicious, quick breakfast with amazing coffee. Highly recommend!

author: Jon Rogers
text: This place was absolutely worth the wait! It was packed when we arrived, so be ready to wait a bit, but trust me, it‚Äôs worth it. The Reuben was one of the best we‚Äôve ever had, and the homemade chips were perfectly crisp and delicious. The California roll was fresh and tasty, and the spider roll was good too. The shrimp dumplings weren‚Äôt our favorite and tasted a bit frozen, but everything else more than made up for it. The Cobb salad was a great portion and very flavorful, and the red ale was cold, refreshing, and paired perfectly with the meal. Overall, amazing food and great service,definitely recommend!

author: N Sockwell
text:
Jumbo Tavern Lobster roll and Texas Burger.  This was my first ever lobster roll and I loved it.  It was such a large portion I thought I would never finish it, I was wrong, I ate ever last bite and the fries along with it!  The hubby enjoyed his burger and fries also.  We sat at the bar with a view of the water.  Service was excellent.  The bartender recommended which lobster roll to get and I am so happy with the choice.  Drinks: Tito‚Äôs & lemonade and the hubby got a local IPA.üç∫
Clean bathrooms.

author: Tisha Burgess
text:
Perfect Kickoff to Our Martha‚Äôs Vineyard Stay

Lookout Tavern was the very first restaurant we visited when we arrived on the island, and it set the tone for a fantastic trip. Our party of six enjoyed a total of four (maybe five!) warm lobster rolls, one shrimp platter, four rum punches, and one or two lemonades‚Äîand everything was fresh, flavorful, and delicious. The lobster rolls were especially memorable‚Äîtender lobster meat, perfectly seasoned, and served warm.

Before our meals arrived, we shared calamari and fried oysters as appetizers, and both were absolutely delicious‚Äîcrispy, well-seasoned, and the perfect way to start the meal.

When we arrived, we were told the wait might be around 30 minutes, but in reality, it was only about 10. That gave us just enough time to take a quick walk across the pier and enjoy the view before being seated. We were placed at a comfortable picnic table with a great view of the lively scene around us‚Äîpeople enjoying good food, great weather, and relaxed island vibes.

The service was friendly, the food came out quickly, and the overall atmosphere made for the perfect kickoff to our stay on the Vineyard. We will absolutely be back on our next visit‚Äîespecially for those lobster rolls!

author: Susan Macbeth
text: Fabulous sports bar with a lively atmosphere, great drinks, tasty food, and wonderful staff. The clam chowder soup was hot and terrific, fried clams and French fries was a hit. Sushi was amazing, so fresh, tasty, and delicious.  Service was excellent and fast despite how busy it was. It was worth the wait!

author: Ais Quezada
text:
Lookout Tavern in Martha's Vineyard is truly a gem! From the moment we arrived, it was clear why this place is so popular ‚Äì it was absolutely packed, a sure sign of a fantastic establishment. We were quoted a 45-minute wait, but to our pleasant surprise, it ended up being much shorter, which was a great start to the evening.
Once seated, the service was great, attentive despite the bustling atmosphere, making us feel well taken care of. And the food? Exceptional! Every dish was prepared with care, fresh, and bursting with flavor. It's the kind of meal that makes you want to linger and savor every bite.
Adding to the overall magic was the beautiful view. Overlooking the water, it provided the perfect backdrop for a memorable meal. Between the lively atmosphere, the fantastic service, the incredible food, and the stunning scenery, we absolutely loved this place. Lookout Tavern is a must-visit on Martha's Vineyard!

author: Jacqueline Onder
text:
Seafood restaurant with a texmex flair.
Quesadillas with lobster or scallops was delicious. Average price $26
They have 3 mini fried oyster tacos in soft tortillas if that's your thing.
The best thing I tried and loved was there Street Corn.
Soo good. $9.00 for 3  1/2 Cobs.

author: Chef Chris Paul
text: Okay what an awesome little place Smallville with wonderful stuff hot or cold drinks available t-shirts sodas ice cream all the good knick-knacks definitely a must let's see located all the way at the other side of nantucket's island.

author: John Rubino
text: I‚Äôm training to walk the Camino. Millie‚Äôs is a 10 mile round trip  walk from where I am staying on Nantucket. Overall, very tasty food. I had the shrimp tacos paired with a wonderful rice salad, roasted corn clam chowder and a corona. Was it worth the 50$? Anywhere else but Nantucket, I would say no. This is the land of 5.54 gal gas. I can say it was worth the 10 mile walk! Will come back again.

author: Hope Cordonier
text:
Received 2 watery, tasteless coffees.
Correct change was not given since clerk said ‚Äúwe round up‚Äù to the customer‚Äôs disadvantage. Upon further discussion, correct change was given with multiple sarcastic comments being made by this clerk.

author: Andre McMahon
text: Great little store in Madaket! You can get a lot of essentially here and great snacks and beverages! Cora McMahon works here!

author: Hannah Frank
text: Liz did an AMAZING job with our wedding cake (and cupcakes)! We couldn‚Äôt have been happier. The cake and cupcakes were beautiful and delicious, and we both got the flavors we dreamed of (chocolate raspberry and red velvet). We can‚Äôt recommend her highly enough!

author: Shane Tank
text: I have used Cakes By Liz countless times in the last 3 years and has exceeds all expectations time and again. Specialty wedding and birthday cakes, cupcakes, french macaroons and key lime pies are only a few of the decadent creations I have received from her. Family members with allergies are no problem. Best on the island, cannot praise highly enough! Thanks Liz!

author: N Sockwell
text:
Yummy!  I had the turkey burger with cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato and guacamole. The hubby had the smoke bacon burger with cheddar cheese, lettuce, onion and pickles. I like that you order your burger and when it is ready you go up to the ‚Äúbar‚Äù and pick your toppings.
Small place, seats @20, no restroom.

author: Michael James Dreyer
text:
Awful.
Terrible.
Bad.
Ignored.
I figured a $37 lobster roll should be the best on the planet? Instead‚Ä¶I got food poisoning for 48 hours. It was rough. The initial vomiting was the worst!!!
I contacted the company via email considering it‚Äôs the only means they provide for  communication with zero correspondence, hence this review. Otherwise, I would‚Äôve gotten a refund and moved on.
But now, I‚Äôm being ignored!

author: Aaron Pacheco
text: Food was incredible and the price was right.    It really seemed to be a good local place where a lot of workers were coming in for lunch.

author: Matthew Stabile
text: Fantastic food - by far the best deal on a lobster roll we found on the island. The burger was delicious and the lobster roll was absolutely packed with a half pound of deliciousness! No adult beverages served - so the pro tip is to eat your main meal here and then visit the other local establishments.

author: Anne C
text: I was totally impressed with this place. My friend Vee kept raving about their lobster roll how good it was. I was skeptical at first because another place on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard was hyped up and it was a let down‚Ä¶.but Fat Ronnie‚Äôs was on point. Lots of lobster meat and very very tasty. I gave it a 10 for sure.. follow me on IG @globaltravelimagery for more content

author: Blaire Hales
text: Delicious food and an awesome atmosphere. Definitely recommend the chowder fries or a lobster roll when you go! They used to have a salad with goat cheese and steak on the menu that was awesome if I recall correctly, but didn't see it the last time we went. Definitely a staple while you're on the island.

author: Holly Burgett
text: Very good food. Good portion sizes. Exactly what you want for a nice dinner. Our waitress was so friendly. We had spent the day biking so this really hit the spot. We got the lobster roll, turkey blt, and penne with chicken. Ate everything

author: Carman Carter
text:
Great place to pull up to the bar, have cocktails, order some food, and just hang out for a while.  Our bartender was just fantastic!  The food REALLY GOOD!  Especially the short rib ravioli!!!  WOW!!!
We went back for the game the next night and boy was that fun!!! Lots of locals cheering on the Boston Celtics!  So much fun!!!

author: Joshua D
text: Do not go here!! The service was not great and our server was acting luke we were and inconvenience to her before we had even given our drink orders. The only thing good here was the potato skin appetizer and the fries which came with the pulled pork. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich which came out watery and the bread was mushy. The sandwich just didn‚Äôt taste right. Another member of my party ordered a burger well done and it still had some pink in it. Finally, the house salad that came with the burger was inedible due to the balsamic dressing that was served, that was like sludge. Not a great spot especially for the price!!

author: Kathy Escott
text: The best fish sandwich we've ever had, hands down! The fish was so delicately fried and full of flavor. It was absolutely delicious. Just thinking about it is making my mouth water. Too bad it's 3000 miles away lol. We will definitely revisit next time we're on Martha's Vineyard.

author: Yasmine Merced (Yaz)
text:
Absolutely delicious and bursting with flavor for that home good feel kind of comfort food by the water.

I was not expecting such an amazing meal and it was served so quickly and fresh.

The were very friendly and off take out service only but with the massive portions you get and the  view you get just outside the door and by the sea wall.... Well worth the travel!

author: Charlie Matthews
text: This is top 5 one of the best overall restaurants I‚Äôve ever been to. Whoever is rating this low probably complains about everything. Get back in your Subaru and take a hike back to the snob convention. Seriously, I travel the US each week for work and seek out great diners, drive ins, and dives. This is Guy Fieri worthy! Huge portions, excellent flavors, great menu selections, and super friendly staff. No tables to eat at inside, take out only, but the sea wall out front offers a million dollar view and seating option. This is real people food. And will add some pounds to you too if you don‚Äôt watch out. If makes me want to visit the Vineyard just to have it again! Mmmmm

author: Spiral Tote
text: 7MAY2021 Wonderful food and service. I arrived before the last ferry was about to leave. This is my go-to-spot whenever I come to the island. I had ample time to order and eat outside the restaurant. The pizza and wings were delicious!

author: Gabriel Pag√°n
text: food was delicious and well priced for the amount of food you get and the quality of the ingredients. The gentleman who took my order was also very nice. I will definitely be coming back when I visit MV again.

author: Bruce & Tawnee Untethered
text: The food is very good. This restaurant is take out only. I had the jerked chicken wrap which was huge. Tawnee had the chicken strips with fries. We were there midweek after Labor Day. The food was fresh and tasty and reasonably priced for Nantucket. We waited outside watching the harbor until they called our order. We ate our meal at a picnic table along the harbor front. The seagulls were standing by waiting for an opportunity. One did try to land on the table to grab something towards the end of our meal. We recommend this restaurant.

author: mary wurthman
text:
I know it all comes down to preference sometimes when it comes to the perfect slice‚Ä¶
But I‚Äôll still say with confidence that this is the best slice on the island. Absolute perfect pies.
Here is my mushroom sausage hot honey slice!

author: Ed Holden
text: Good slice shop convenient to the ferry terminal in Vineyard Haven. I had a couple specialty slices, which are listed above the registers. Both were solid: wide and flat and a little greasy. Vaguely NY style, no char. There's no interior seating, but there are picnic tables nearby. A parking lot serves this pizzeria among other businesses, and has bathrooms that close in the mid afternoon. The lot has plenty of parking spaces much of the time, but on busy ferry days (probably summer weekends) spaces are scarce. I visited while someone else sat in the car at the ferry terminal before our departure.

author: Christopher Dobransky
text: By far the best pizza on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. Hands down. That is all you really know. If you like fresh pies and slices, this crust, no flop and a boisterous, hilarious, charismatic staff THIS IS THE PLACE! Porto is worth a trip to the island all on its own! You don‚Äôt want to miss out!

author: Celeste Mattson
text: Porto pizza is by far my favorite pizza on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard! The sauce is flavorful the crust is perfect and the ratio of toppings to sauce is balanced so your slice is never soggy! Not over greasy either! Been going here for years and my husband has been going his whole life!

author: Mike
text: Stopped here for a quick slice of pizza while in the area. I thought that the pizza was really good and it was nice that they had outdoor seating available. If you get off the ferry, this is only a 2 min walk!

author: Lee Anjju Productions
text: If you like your pizza slices thicker, then this is the place! I find the negative reviews very amusing üòÇ. I would say just try it and make your own judgment everyone is different and every restaurant has their slight differences.

author: Evan Keller
text: The food was good overall. A bit smaller sizing to the pizzas than I am typically used too but they make up for it with the toppings. Everything tasted great, would definitely go back!

author: Kate Marino
text: Great place for take out, pizza is thicker crust than most places but not deep dish. Friendly service. Not really an eat-in place, although there is a small area with two tables if you need a quick bite.

author: Anne Cooper
text: The pizza was legitimately wet. Soaked. Floppy. Did they dunk it in water before handing it to us? we'll never know. Really disgusting.

author: Angela Godwin
text: So‚Ä¶ not sure why this place has poor ratings. Pizza was possibly the best on the island. (I do love OB pizza though‚Ä¶ ) not sure about the rest of food here and I didn‚Äôt sit in- I took to go. I will 100% be ordering pizza here again. It was also fast (ordered 2 large pies to go) and cheap, $35 total.

author: Michael P
text:
L‚Äô√©toile Restaurant provides an exceptional upscale dining experience within a beautiful setting, both indoors and outdoors. Located inside the hotel, the ambiance is perfect for an intimate dinner or a family outing. The hostess and staff were friendly and professional, making the evening even more enjoyable.

I began my meal with the pan-seared, spice-crusted fresh La Belle Farm duck foie gras, which was honestly the best foie gras I've ever tasted. The charred factor added a unique twist, enhancing the flavor without overpowering the delicate texture, allowing the foie gras to still melt in your mouth.

For the entr√©e, I chose the √©tuv√©e of 1 1/2-pound Menemsha lobster, a dish bursting with flavor. The sauce, highlighted by roasted garlic, truly made the lobster shine. To finish, I enjoyed an espresso martini, one of the best I've had in a long time. This version used chocolate liquor, offering a delightful twist on the classic drink.

While I wasn't a fan of the "Matcha My Freak" and "Whistle While You Work" cocktails, I suspect it was more due to my personal taste preferences. Despite this, I am eager to return and try other drinks on the menu.

Overall, L‚Äô√©toile Restaurant is a fantastic location for an elegant dining experience. I highly recommend it for those seeking a sophisticated meal in a picturesque setting.

author: Felix Mihelea
text:
By far the best dining experiences I‚Äôve ever had. I wholeheartedly trust L‚Äôetoile with all of my special occasions.

The atmosphere is charming inside as well as outside on the patio. Once you get used to the outstanding level of service that is provided here, it is hard to go back to most restaurants.

The menu provides enough choices for any level of pickiness, and you can absolutely taste the hard work and ingenuousness behind it in every single bite.

The cocktails are out of this world, and, combined with the amazing atmosphere at the bar, I often meet my friends here to enjoy a cocktail and have an amazing time. Every time.

author: Adam Kotzman
text: The dining experience here is formal and classy. With white table clothes and plenty of greenery around it makes for a nice date night out. The food was very good but just shy of being excellent. It‚Äôs a must stop if in Edgartown whether you want dinner or a few drinks.

author: Dave Gordon
text: My Wife and I had an amazing dining experience at L'Etoile from the moment we arrived to good bye!  We ate out in the front yard which made all the difference.   The lawn dining area / open tent is close enough to the street to see people go by but not too close for comfort.  The garden area as you walk in was in peak bloom.  It was a cool summer night with soft blues playing from a bar close by.   We had Oysters Two-Styles.  I Never had an oyster with cream in the shell, very good and std vinegar type. Excellent.  The Menemsha Lobster was prepared perfectly and so was the Rack of  Lamb Chops.   I would go back in a heartbeat but it took months to get a reservation.  Cost for dinner and drinks for two was $213 + tip.   A real night to remember.

author: Jane Ma Nolan
text:
My husband and I had dinner at l'etoile for our wedding anniversary and we're impressed by the restaurant's ambience, food, and level of service.

Food:
- Braised short ribs ($22) were delicious but it was the maple-smoked cheddar polenta that temped us to lick the plate clean
- Lamb chop ($52) was delicious, no gamey-ness at all. The accompanying spinach and roast tomato grape leaf tartlet seemed random but was very tasty!
- Lobster ($68) was delicious, as was the pasta. That said, this entree was spendy.

Ambience:
Like many businesses in Edgartown, this restaurant is in a house, with seating on the front lawn on Adirondack chairs, inside in tastefully renovated rooms with mood lighting, or outside under a semi-permanent tent that still has tables dressed with white tablecloths and decorated as tastefully as the restaurant's indoor dining tables.

Service:
The staff were very friendly, attentive, well-trained, quick with the water refills, and not too stuffy or pompous. We felt very welcome!

Parking:
Street parking only, which can be hard to come by in the area, even during the off season.
